loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion to cover her children's college expenses

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: N. Joy is 34 years old, married with four children and hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells Notebooks. She needs $600 to enable her buy more books to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy more books to sell.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of four, Massan A. is 33 years old and has been a retailer of ready-to-wear outfits for five year at the big market in Kpalimé. Given that her husband lost his job over ten months ago, she covers nearly all household expenses and the cost of schooling her children thanks to the income from her business. She wants to use these funds to buy five bails of clothing to expand her business, to meet customer demand, and to clear more of a profit for the survival of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, madame Massan A. est âgée de 33 ans et est revendeuse des tenues prêts à porter au grand marché de Kpalimé depuis 05 ans. Elle subvient presque à toutes les dépenses du foyer et les charges scolaires de ses enfants grâce aux revenus provenant de son activité étant donné que son mari a perdu son emploi depuis plus de 10 mois. Madame Massan veut, par ces fonds acheter 05 balles d’habits pour élargir la taille de son commerce, satisfaire la demande de la clientèle et dégager plus de bénéfices pour la survie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy five bails of ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Patricia.

texts.en: Patricia I. is 35 years old, is married with four children, and hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State. She sells drinks and bakes snacks for sale and has been in business since 2003. She needs a loan of $600 to enable her buy an industrial oven to make her business more profitable. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy an industrial oven.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria is 42 years old and a single mother of two boys and a girl, all of whom attend school. Victoria has been selling men’s and women’s clothing for three years in the El Carretón community of San Cristobal. Currently Victoria is the coordinator of a group of five women who own and operate the same kind of business in the community. The entrepreneur wants to expand her business and add new products, such as silver jewelry, to her inventory. Victoria wants to keep running her business to support her children’s educations and her family’s well-being. The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.

NOTE: The members of the group warrant one another’s loans. If one of the women fails in repaying the loan, the other members will have to take the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk and silver jewelry

loans.name: Titilope

texts.en: Titilope O. is 32 years old, married and has two kids, and hails from Igbolerin, Lagos State. She sells provisions and drinks and learned her trading skills for three years. She needs a loan of $450 to enable her buy more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks.

loans.name: Groupement Miwodeka

texts.fr:
The MIWODEKA Group was created five years ago by ten young women. It specializes in producing traditional soaps made from red oil. This soap is used mostly by the local population, which explains the strong demand. The income from their business enables them in part to cover household expenses. They would like to use this loan to buy a hundred 50-liter drums of red oil and to lease a store for stocking their production.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupement MIWODEKA est créé depuis 05 ans par 10 jeunes femmes et spécialisé dans la préparation de savons traditionnels à base de l’huile rouge. Ce savon est utilisé en majorité par la population locale ce qui explique une forte demande. Les revenus de leur activité leur permettent de supporter en partie les charges de leur foyer. Elles souhaitent par ce crédit acheter 100 bidons de 50 litres d’huiles rouges et louer un magasin pour le stockage de leur production.

loans.use: To buy a hundred 50-liter drums of red oil and to lease a store

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort K. is 42 years old, married with two children and hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a photographer and also sells film. She needs $600 to enable her buy additional cameras and film.

loans.use: To buy additional cameras and film

loans.name: Fatimon

texts.en: Fatimum O. is 29 years old and married with three children. She is a fashion designer and has been in business since the year 2000. She needs a loan of $450 to buy sewing materials in bulk.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials in bulk.

loans.name: Sitsofe

texts.fr:
Sitsofe A. is 33 years old, married, and the mother of five. She has been a retailer of grains at the big market in Adeta for over six years. Since her husband is a polygamist, she is responsible for covering the cost of schooling her children. She would like to use this loan to buy 10 sacks of corn, 5 sacks of peanuts, and 5 sacks of millet and to lease a store for stocking her goods. This will meet the ever-growing demands of her customers and will provide for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Sitsofe A. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché de ADETA depuis plus de 06 ans. Son mari étant polygame les frais scolaires de ses enfants sont à sa propre charge. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 05 sacs d’arachides, 05 sacs de mils et louer un magasin pour le stockage de ses marchandises pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of corn, 5 sacks of peanuts, 5 sacks of millet, and to lease a store for her inventory of goods.

loans.name: Maarifa D Group

texts.en:
Seleman C., age 42, is married with four children ages 17, 11, 6 and 2. He has a one year old fish business that makes a monthly profit of about $22.

In the past, Seleman took out four loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his business. He now hopes for a new loan to continue increasing his capital. He will share this loan with his sub group members who have businesses dealing in selling chacoal, shop, clothes and table tops.

In the picture, Seleman is first from the left.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo S. is a mother of three and is 45 years old and lives in Okoko, Lagos State. She produces nylon which she supplies to her community market and she has been in business for 10 years.She needs a loan of $450 to buy more un-produced nylon materials for production purposes.

loans.use: To buy uncut nylon in bulk for production.

loans.name: Loicith

texts.en:
Loicith V. R. runs an internet café and call center in the jungle city of Tarapoto, San Martin.  In her café she has 8 computers and 3 phone booths.   The majority of her clients are the neighborhood students doing research for their school projects, using instant messenger, or playing video games.  For this reason she also sells snack foods and sodas.   
Loicith is 31 years old, married, and has one small child.  She always dreamed of having her own business so she couldn’t be happier.  She is also proud that she will be able to give her son the opportunity to study whatever he wants and fulfill any dreams he may have.
A member of the community bank Nuestra Sra De La Paz, Loicith is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over six months.  With the loan she would like to buy cameras, and headphones for the computers and do some computer maintenance.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to buy cameras and headphones for the computers and do some computer maintenance

loans.name: Groupe Aminou & Frere

texts.fr:
AMINOU & BROS. is owned by five persons specializing in the sale of fuel. Given the disastrous condition of the roads, tanker trucks cannot supply the area. So these individuals came together to supply the area's inhabitants by going into town for fuel. This business has been owned by this group for over five years. Using this loan, they wish to install a storage tank in order to meet the very fast-growing demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

AMINOU & FRERES est tenu par 5 personnes spécialisé dans la vente de carburant. Etant donné l’état désastreux des routes les camions citernes ne peuvent pas alimenter la localité. Alors ces particuliers se sont joints pour alimenter habitants de la localité en allant se ravitailler en ville. Ce commerce est tenu par ce groupe depuis plus de 05 ans. Par ces fonds, ils désirent se faire installer une citerne afin de satisfaire la demande très croissante de la population.

loans.use: To buy and install a storage tank

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina R. D. R. lives in Tarapoto, San Martin.  She rents a spot in the major market of Tarapoto where she sells fresh chicken.  She started the business 22 years ago with the help of her husband.  Over the years she has acquired many loyal customers.
Marina is a 58 year old widow and has 1 child.  She has no support so her business is everything for her.  She works hard and has saved carefully to send her child to school.  Now she is building a small disco in her home where her neighbors can come and enjoy a night out.  Marina is very social and popular.
A member of the community bank Nuestra Sra D. La Paz, Marina is requesting a loan of s/3000 to repay over 6 months.  With this loan she would like to buy more chicken to sell at the market.

loans.use: With this loan she would like to buy more chicken to sell at the market.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is a mother of five, married and is 56 years old. She hails from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes and stationeries and has been in business for over 20 years. She needs a loan of $1200 to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan lives in Calle Pasco n. 1175 of San Jose de Yunguyo zone, located in El Alto city. He lives with his three children ages 17, 12 and 8. He makes a living by making leather handbags, wallets, coin purses in his home's workshop. He wishes to use the credit to purchase more materials (leather, liners, threads, etc) to be able to continue with his business. This is his second credit with Impro, the evaluation made qualifies him for another loan. He is an IMPRO client since February 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Froilan vive Calle Pasco n. 1175 de la zona San jose de Yunguyo, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 12 y 8 años respectivamente. Trabaja en la confección de chamarras de cuero, monederos y billeteras, en su taller que se encuentra en su domicilio. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material (cuero, forros, hilos, etc.) para desempeñar su trabajo. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde Febrero de 2007

loans.use: Purchase of leather, linings, threads in order to make handbags and wallets

loans.name: Lauristela

texts.en:
Lauristela E. D. P. runs a call center and general store in the neighborhood of Partido Alta in Tarapoto, San Martin.  In the shop she has a cell phone which she charges neighbors to come and use.  Before she had phone booths but she found that her clients preferred to use cell phones so she got rid of them.  Now her business is more profitable and she is much happier.
Lauristela is 56 years old, happily married, and has four children.  Three of her four children are independent and the last is studying accounting at an institute.  The futures of her children are very important to Lauristela, she has worked hard and saved responsibly all of her life so they could have more opportunities than she did.  
A member of the community bank Nuestra Sra D. La Paz, Lauristela is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months.  There are two major cell phone service providers in Peru.  Lauristela would like to use the loan to buy a cell phone of the competing service provider she already has.  The two service providers offer different perks.  With the new cell phone she will be able to attract more clients

loans.use: There are two major cell phone service providers in Peru.  Lauristela would like to use the loan to buy a cell phone from the competing service provider from the one she already has.  The two service providers offer different perks.  With the new cell phone she will be able to attract more clients

loans.name: Mwashabani

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 52-year-old Mwashabani M.. She is married with four children, who are between 22 and 30 years old, and she has one other dependent, her niece. In 2007, Mwashabani established a poultry business, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional chickens to raise and sell. She thanks you for your support.

Raising "kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. You may ask, "who or what are 'kuku'"? Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital, so you can start with one or two and either add to them as the business grows or wait until they multiple naturally! Second, they require little space. Third, they produce eggs when they grow, and the eggs can either be sold (to provide additional income) or eaten (to provide a supplementary source of protein).

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sulmira

texts.en:
Sulmira G. R. owns a mini-market in the neighborhood of Partido Alta in Tarapoto, San Martin.  She started the store 15 years ago with $300 and a table in her living room.  Now she has a sizeable store which sells goods of primary needs, firewood, meats, fruits, vegetables, candy, and gas in a remodeled garage outside of her house.  She puts her success down to hard work, location, family, and charisma.
Sulmira is now 44 years old, happily married, and has 3 children.  She started the business because she wanted to help her family and she enjoys working.  Everything she does is for her family.  She loves working from home because she gets to spend time with her children.  Her plans for the future are to improve her business and send her youngest child to University.
A member of the community bank Nuestra Sra De La Paz, Sulmira is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months.  With the loan she would like to invest more gas and increase the number of goods she has in stock.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to invest in more gas and increase the number of goods she has in stock.

loans.name: Telesforo

texts.es:
Telesforo works in the raising of dairy cows, selling the milk production to PIL Andina (Milk Production Plant).

He lives in the community of Kallutaka in the Pucarani sector, about three and a half hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his six children of 21,16, 15, 13, 11,and 8 years of age respectively.

He will use the loan to purchase a better quality milking cow which will enable him to increase his milk production, in response to the increased demand from PIL Andina.

This is his first loan with Impro. His financial evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Telesforo se dedica a la cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).

Vive en la Comunidad de Kallutaka sector Pucarani a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz., Junto a sus seis hijos de 21,16,15,13,11y 8 años respectivamente.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mejorada y así incrementar la producción de leche, en vista de la demanda por parte de PIL Andina.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer M. is a taxi driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 30 years old and has been working as a taxi driver for the last 3 years. This will be Azer’s first loan cycle with Norwegian Microcredit. He is looking for funding so that he can make repairs and improvements to his taxi cab.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to his taxi cab.

loans.name: Mutazamo A Group

texts.en:
Ally K., 29 years old and married, is the owner of a three year old cement shop. Open from 6am to 9pm daily, Ally makes a monthly profit of about $69.

In the past, K. took out three previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his business. He now hopes for a new loan to continue expanding his business. He will share this loan with his sub group members dealing in telephones sales, pool tables and clothes.

In the picture, K. is in the middle.

loans.use: To buy more cement

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Neema T.. She is not married but has two 11-year-old children. In 2006, Neema established a tailoring business, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional materials and sewing accessories. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase material and accessories for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sweets and candies for a small business

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
Silvestre raises dairy cows, selling the milk production to PIL Andina (Milk Production Plant).

He lives in the community of Kallutaka in the Pucarani sector, about three and a half hours from the city of La Paz. He is a widower and lives with his son and daughter in law.

He will use the loan to purchase a better quality milking cow which will enable him to increase his milk production in response to the increased demand from PIL Andina.

This is his first loan with Impro. His financial evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Silvestre se dedica a la cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).

Vive en la Comunidad de Kallutaka sector Pucarani a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz., El es viudo y vive junto a su hijo y su hija política.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así incrementar la producción de leche, en vista de la demanda incrementada de PIL Andina.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa G. is 33 years old, single, and the mother of two children. She has had this photocopy booth for almost two years. The income from her business is used mostly for repairing the photocopier, which is out-dated. She would like to use this loan to acquire a new photocopier and to buy 10 cartons of paper in order to meet strong customer demand and thus to provide for her own needs and those of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Yawa G. est âgée de33 ans, célibataire et mère de 02 enfants. Elle tient cette cabine de photocopie bientôt 02 ans. Les revenus issus de son activité sont utilisés dans en majorité pour le dépannage de la photocopieuse étant donné que cette dernière est une vieillerie. Madame Yawa souhaite par ce crédit acquérir une nouvelle photocopieuse et acheter 10 cartons de papiers rames afin de répondre à la forte demande de la clientèle et par là subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy a new photocopier and 10 cartons of paper

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah O.is a mother of four married and is 48 years old. She hails from and lives in Okoko, Lagos state. She sells drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs

loans.name: Behruz

texts.en: Behruz E. owns and operates a wood shop in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz, where he makes furniture. He is 42 years old and is married with two children. He has been working in this business for the last 8 years and is currently looking for funding so that he can purchase new woodworking tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his wood shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bedclothes, curtains and other goods for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a wide range of products to replenish a grocery store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz lives on Luis Espinal Avenue, Street 4 of the Puerto Mejillones zone of the city of El Alto.

She lives with her husband, who works as a salaried driver, and two children of 10 and 13 years of age. Beatriz works in the sale of prepaid mobile phone cards.

She will use the loan proceeds to buy merchandise (prepaid phone cards) to increase her sales and therefore her income.

This is her first loan with Impro. Her financial evaluation makes her eligible for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz vive en la avenida Luís Espinal, calle 4 de la zona Puerto Mejillones, de la cuidad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer asalariado y dos hijos de 10 y 13 años respectivamente. Beatriz se dedica al la venta de tarjetas pre-pago para telefonía móvil.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería ( tarjetas pre-pago) y así incrementar sus ventas y por lo tanto sus ingresos.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (prepaid mobile phone cards)

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Mwajuma C.. In 2006, Mwajuma established a general store, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional goods in bulk for her store. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods in bulk for her general store.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en: Griselda is in her early thirties, and she has three school-going daughters. Griselda owns and operates a grocery store, which she started seven years ago. Every day, people in the neighborhood visit her store to purchase different kinds of products, such as rice, vegetables, milk, beans and other basic foodstuffs. Griselda hopes not only to satisfy her customers with good-quality products, but she also wants to expand her business and add new products to her inventory. That way, she’ll attract new clients to the business. The entrepreneur wants to be one of the most well-established suppliers of these goods in her area.

loans.use: Purchase of products to restock a grocery store

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin Adekunle is married and has four children. She is 40 years old and hails from Ijanikin, Lagos state, Nigeria. Toyin needs a loan of $1200 to enable her buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Boyukaga

texts.en: Boyukaga M. owns and operates a wood shop in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz, where he makes furniture. Boyukaga is 37 years old and is married with three children. He is currently looking for funding so that he can purchase new tools for his shop that will allow him to do sophisticated work more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his wood shop

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela lives on Luís Espinal Avenue, street 4 of the Puerto Mejillones zone in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband who works as a hired driver and she has a newborn baby. She sells candy at a street stand located on the main avenue in El Alto city. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (candy of dfferent flavors and brands) and thereby be able to increase her sales and income. This is the first loan with Impro, and she qualifies to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Pamela vive en la avenida Luís Espinal, calle 4 de la zona Puerto Mejillones, de la cuidad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer asalariado y una bebe recién nacida. Se dedica al la venta de golosinas (dulces) en un puesto callejero ubicado en la avenida principal de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería (dulces de diferentes sabores y marcas) y así poder incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Buy candy of different flavors and brands to sell in her stand.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana, is a very hardworking woman that is always aware of the wishes of her family; many years of hard work and effort have allowed her and her husband to manage their own businesses and be able to finance the dreams of their children. Ana wants to be able to keep her family together and at the same time has a deep sorrow knowing that her mother has pancreatic cancer. For this reason, she wants to take advantage of every moment to spend time with her mother and her family and wishes to forge ahead despite all the sad moments in her life that she won't let defeat her. As part of her improvement projects, she wishes to increase her income through increasing her inventory of wood. To bring this to fruition, she asks for a loan so she can improve her dear mother's quality of life if only for a few months. Support this woman of great valor and strength.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Ana, es una dama muy trabajadora que siempre está pendiente D. los deseos D. su familia, muchos años D. trabajo y esfuerzo han logrado que ella y su esposo en la actualidad manejen sus propios negocios y ambos son parte importante del financiamiento D. los sueños que sus hijos albergan. Ana tiene los enormes deseos D. mantener unida a su familia y a la vez tiene una pena muy profunda al saber que su anciana madre tiene cáncer D. páncreas por esa razón quiere aprovechar cada momento al lado D. su querida madre y D. los suyos y quiere seguir adelante a pesar D. los momentos tristes D. su vida y ya que manifiesta no se dejará vencer por las adversidades. Como parte D. sus proyectos está la mejora D. sus ingresos económicos por ello incrementará su capital en la compra D. madera y para iniciar este hecho solicita un préstamo, convencida D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su querida madre aunque sea por pocos meses.Apoya a esta mujer D. gran valor y fortaleza.

loans.use: Influx of capital to acquire a larger quantity of wood.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Fatuma K.. She is married with one 11-year-old child. In 2002, Fatuma established a hair salon, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional hair-care products in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional hair-care products and accessories in bulk for her hair salon.

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Maximo is a very hard-working person that has always wanted the best for his family. He is from Raquina and decided to work his own farm lands as a good way to provide for his family. He dedicates himself to growing alfalfa, lettuce, chinese onions, peas, and corn. He also raises guinea pigs. Proudly he tells us that he just harvested his pea crop and sold it in the city center with the help of his dear wife. Unfortunately the low price on his products has led his wife to find work in the city of Lima and her departure has brought much sadness. He still wishes to continue dedicating himself to his noble work in hopes of soon being together with his partner again. With the desire to improve the quality of his products, he's been attending agriculture courses and buys guides on raising guinea pigs. To put into practice what he has learned, he asks for a loan to start his next planting. Support this humble farmer, a hard-worker and family man.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Máximo, es una persona muy trabajadora, que siempre ha luchado por otorgarle lo mejor a su familia. Él es natural de Raquina y decidió trabajar sus propios campos de cultivo como una buena opción de desarrollo para los suyos es por esa razón que se dedica al cultivo de la alfalfa, lechuga, cebollitas chinas, arveja y maíz; también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes. Muy satisfecho nos cuenta que acaba de recoger su cosecha de arveja que los llevó a comercializar al centro de su ciudad con la ayuda de su querida esposa. El bajo precio de sus productos han obligado el desplazamiento de su querida esposa a la ciudad de Lima y su partida lo ha sumergido en mucha tristeza; sin embargo está deseoso de seguir dedicándose a su noble labor para pronto poder estar junto a su compañera. Así mismo con el afán de mejorar la calidad de sus productos ha estado asistiendo a cursos de capacitación agrícola y compra boletines acerca de la crianza de cuyes.Con el deseo de poner en práctica lo aprendido solicita un préstamo para iniciar su próxima siembra.Apoya a este humilde agricultor esforzado y buen padre de familia.

loans.use: Injection of capital to buy better seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a woman that has always promoted family unity and is very aware of this fact. She and her husband started selling wood about six years ago; they buy tree trunks in large quantities and turn them into cut pieces of wood and firewood that they sell. In about 3 hours, Elizabeth and her husband, Clemente, work with an ax and electric chainsaw to cut the wood. Everyday requires much effort as this type of work is very tiring. Their desire to contribute to the academic and professional education of their children aged ten and twelve is their main motivation. For this reason they wish to increase their invested capital in order to buy more wood to convert into firewood for their business. Let us help them with their request so this happy family can continue living a harmonious and tranquil economic life in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, es una mujer que promueve siempre la unión familiar y está muy pendiente de este hecho. Ella y su esposo instalaron hace unos seis años el negocio de venta de madera, compran troncos en cantidad para luego convertirlos en puntales y leña que ofertan por cantidad, en un tiempo aproximado de 3 horas Elizabeth y su esposo, Clemente, elaboran con su hacha y la ayuda de una sierra eléctrica elaboran trozos de madera, cada día requiere de mucho esfuerzo debido a que esta rutina de trabajo diaria es muy agotadora.Los deseos de contribuir con la formación académica y profesional de sus queridos hijos de 10 y doce años de edad son el mejor motivo de aliento. Por esa razón desean incrementar su capital de inversión a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de madera para convertirlos en leña para su posterior oferta.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta feliz familia siga manteniendo la armonía y tranquilidad económica dentro de su hogar.

loans.use: Influx of capital to buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Rhoda K.. She is married with four children, who are between the ages of 12 and 24 years old. In 2007, Rhoda established a clothing business. Rhoda has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now seeks another loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Rhoda is a perfect example of why micro-finance works and why the vast majority of people in her position repay their loans. A lot of people who hear about micro-finance (or kiva.org) for the first time wonder “how do you make sure people pay back their loans?" and "won't the borrowers just take the money?” Such questions wrongfully imply that the individuals who access micro-credit (usually the "poor") are less trustworthy, efficient, or educated than other people. Regardless, most MFIs have due diligence procedures in place to assess client risk, as well as measures (e.g., collateral arrangements and group lending, where a loan in default is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk. More importantly, there is an incentive that is built into each and every micro-loan: the borrowers are incentivized to repay their loans so that they can receive additional loans as their businesses continue to grow.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Eyitayo

texts.en: Eyitayo O. is 50 years old, has three children and is divorced. She lives in Lyanuran, Lagos state. She produces and supplies bread to surrounding communities and markets. She is soliciting for a loan of $1200 to enable her to increase her production unit limit.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar, and yeast in bulk in order to increase production.

loans.name: Elsen

texts.en: Elsen A. is a taxi driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 21 years old and has been working as a taxi driver for the last 3 years. He is currently looking for funding so he can make some much needed repairs and improvements to his taxi cab.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to his taxi cab

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga lives on Luís Espinal Avenue, Street 4 in the Puerto Mejillones area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband who has an auto repair shop and her two children, ages 24 and 13. Olga sells vegetables in a street stall located on the city’s main avenue. The loan is to buy more merchandise (lettuce, beans, radishes, etc.) and thereby increase her sales and her income. This is her first loan with Impro, and her evaluation qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Olga vive en la avenida Luís Espinal, calle 4 de la zona Puerto Mejillones, de la cuidad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo el cual tiene un taller de refacción de autos, y sus dos hijos de 24 y 13 años respectivamente. Olga se dedica al la venta de legumbres y hortalizas en un puesto callejero ubicado en la avenida principal. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de más mercadería (lechugas, habas, rábanos, etc.) y así incrementar sus ventas y por lo tanto sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Compra de legumbres y hortalizas para su puesto de vernta.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam is a hard-working woman, daily she works in the store she started in her home three years ago because she’s always wanted to get ahead but at the same time not miss taking care of her 4 school aged children. Difficult life circumstances where they lacked financial security in the home were no obstacle for their loving and supportive household. To stay together she’s always looked for alternative jobs with her husband’s help and support. When she noticed that her neighborhood didn’t have a store nearby that her neighbors could buy different food products, Miriam decided to open a store with some small savings that she had and with the help of her husband has been working hard to increase her sales. She is always willing to improve her store as this is one of her family’s main sources of income. For the moment Miriam continues to hold many hopes and wishes for her family, her biggest desire being augmenting her store with more merchandise that will increase it’s profits. Help Miriam, a diligent and hard-working woman, realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Miriam es una mujer esforzada, día a día trabaja en la tienda que instaló en su casa, hace tres años porque su deseo siempre ha sido desempeñarse sin descuidar la atención de sus cuatro queridos hijos que aún se encuentran en edad escolar; las circunstancias difíciles de la vida en las que existían carencias económicas dentro de su hogar no fueron obstáculo para que coexista el amor y apoyo entre sus miembros, es así que para mantenerse unidos siempre ha visto la manera de buscar alternativas de trabajo con la firme ayuda y compromiso de su querido esposo.Cuando observó que en su barrio no había una tienda cercana en la que sus vecinos adquieran diferentes productos alimenticios, Miriam decidió con unos pequeños ahorros aperturar su pequeña tienda y con apoyo de su esposo la ha estado implementando para que sus ventas se incrementen, ella pone mucha atención y dedicación si se trata de buenos consejos para aumentar sus ventas y siempre está dispuesta a mejorar ya que es una de las fuentes de ingreso de su familia más importante. Por el momento Miriam continúa albergando muchas esperanzas y deseos para su familia y su deseo ferviente es implementar mucho más su tienda, con mayor mercadería que le permita obtener mayores ganancias.Ayuda a Miriam una mujer muy diligente y esforzada a cristalizar sus sueños.

loans.use: Influx of capital to buy more basic necessities and products for her little store.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou A., age 29, is married and the mother of two. She has been in this business for three years. Using the income from it, she has covered the costs of schooling for her second child. She would like to use this loan to increase the size of her business by buying 25 bowls, some plates and kitchen utensils, and 5 bolts of pagnes (colorful printed fabrics) to sell.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 29 ans, madame Akou A. est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 03 ans, et par les revenus de son activité, elle a pris en charges les frais scolaires de son deuxième enfant. Elle désire par ces fonds augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant 25 bassines, des assiettes, des ustensiles de cuisine et 05 balles de pagnes pour la revente.

loans.use: To buy 25 bowls, some plates and kitchen utensils, and 5 bolts of pagnes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria lives on Luís Espinal Avenue, Street 4 in the Puerto Mejillones area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her 13 year old daughter, her husband works elsewhere in the state. Victoria sells fruit from a street stand located on the city’s main avenue. The loan is to purchase merchandise (fruit) and thereby increase her sales and her income. This is her first loan with Impro, and her evaluation qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria vive en la avenida Luis Espinal, calle 4 de la zona Puerto Mejillones, de la cuidad de El Alto. Vive junto a su hija de 13 año, su esposo trabajo en el interior del departamento. Victoria se dedica al la venta de fruta en un puesto callejero, ubicado en la avenida principal. El crédito lo destinará a la compra de más mercadería (frutas) y así tratar de incrementar sus ventas y por lo tanto sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Buy fruit for her fruit stand

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en: Israfil E. owns and operates a large dump truck in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 42 years old, married with three children, and has been operating large trucks for the last 21 years. He is currently looking for funding, so he can make repairs and improvements to his large dump truck.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to his large dump truck.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Avelina M.. She is married with four children (ages 6, 7, 9, and 12 years old). In 1999, Avelina established a seamstress business, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional materials and sewing accessories in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and sewing accessories in bulk for her seamstress business.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Mrs. Segundina C. owns her home in the Tupac Amaru area, in the city of La Paz, with her husband, Mr Juan Carlos Zuleta, and their four children. Mrs Segundina works as a domestic employee and her husband works as an embroidery craftsman in their home. This loan will be used to install a sewerage system in their house. This is the fifth time that they are applying for a loan and their credit analysis always comes back favorable. The four previous loans have been repaid according to the terms laid down for each of them.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Segundina C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Tupac Amaru de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Juan Carlos Zuleta y sus cuatro hijos. La señora Segundina trabaja como empleada domestica y su esposo es artesano en bordados en su domicilio. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la instalación de alcantarillado domiciliario. Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Los cuatro créditos anteriores han sido cancelados de acuerdo a los términos establecidas para cada uno de ellos.

loans.use: To install a sewerage system for her home.  "Instalacion de servicio de alcantarillado en su casa."

loans.name: Pudensiana

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Pudensiana K.. She is married with five children, who are between the ages of 12 and 22 years old. In 2000, Pudensiana established a business that sells African batik cloth, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of cloth in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and dyes to make additional batik cloth.

loans.name: Letife

texts.en: Letife M. and her family are cattle breeders in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Letife is 58 years old, married with three children, and has been working in this business for the last 20 years. She is currently looking for funding to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Melahet

texts.en: Melahet B. operates a dairy product stand in the bazaar, located in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She sells different kinds of cheeses as well as milk. Melahet has been working in this business for the last 5 years. She is married with three children and is currently looking for funding so she can expand and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: To expand and diversify her inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel Z. lives in his own home in the Llojeta hillside area, west of the city of La Paz with his wife, Mrs. Florencia Blanco and his two sons. Miguel works as a barber in the Grand Poder area of the city and his wife knits for a living in the "Mother's Center". The loan will be used to pay part of the total cost of a plot of land Mr. Z. acquired in Llojeta, in the city of La Paz. This is the first time that he's applying for a loan and he was approved for the loan because the credit analysis performed came back favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Miguel Z. vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Florencia Blanco y sus dos hijos. Miguel trabaja como peluquero en la zona Gran Poder de nuestra ciudad y su esposa realiza tejidos en un centro de madres de su zona. El crédito solicitado será destinado al pago de parte de costo total de un terreno que el señor Z. esta adquiriendo en la zona de Llojeta, en la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land in the city of La Paz.  (Compra de un terreno en la ciudad de La Paz.)

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Mr. Valentin C. lives in his own home in the Kenani Pata area, west of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Mrs Serapia Mamani and their four children. Mr. Valentin works as a mason on a private property in Villa Nuevo Potosi, alongside his wife who works as assistant bricklayer. The loan will be used for construction of a structural wall on the west side of the neighbor's property, since the absence of this wall puts the neighbor's house at risk of collapse. This is the first time that he's applying for a loan, and he's been approved because the credit analysis performed came back favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Valentín C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Kenani Pata, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Serapia Mamani y sus cuatro hijos. El señor Valentín trabaja como albañil en una propiedad privada en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí, junto a su esposa que cumple las funciones de ayudante de albañil. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de un muro de contención estructural en el lado oeste, que da a la propiedad de su vecino, ya que la ausencia de este muro hace que la vivienda del vecino corra peligro de derrumbe. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: For use to build a structural wall which is in contention. (Construcción de un muro de contención estructural.)

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mr. Mario Z. lives in his own home in the Pasankeri area of La Paz with his wife, Mrs. Celia Coaquira and their three children. Mario works as a messenger and his wife is a domestic employee. They need a loan to finish the construction of two rooms and a bathroom. This is his fourth loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies him favorably and he can obtain this loan. He has been our client since 2004. The three previous loans were repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Mario Z. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Celia Coaquira y sus tres hijos. Mario trabaja como empleado de mensajería y su esposa es empleada domestica. Requieren el crédito para la conclusión de construcción en dos habitaciones y un baño. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Es cliente de nuestra institución desde el año 2004. Los tres préstamos anteriores fueron cancelados en las fechas establecidas.

loans.use: Build two rooms and a bathroom on his home.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz M. is an independent plaster worker in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 30 years old and has been working in this business for the last 5 years. The town of Khachmaz has been growing at an exceptional rate the last few years, resulting in a great demand for Ramiz’s services to increase. He is currently looking for funding, so he can purchase new tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rovshen

texts.en: Rovshen E. and his family (his father is pictured) operate a dairy product stand in the bazaar, located in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Rovshen is 22 years old and has been working in this business for the last 4 years. Rovshen has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for funding to expand and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To expand and diversify his inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes in bulk for a small business

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is a hard-working and persistent woman who fights to improve her family’s lifestyle. Ramona is in her late fifties and she has five children, three of them boys, all of whom are grown-up and have their own families. Currently, the entrepreneur lives with her husband, who is not working.

To make a living, Ramona sells basic foodstuffs such as eggs and spaghetti to people of her community. Sometimes, she purchases beauty products to resell to women of the neighborhood. Ramona explains that she pays special attention to customer demand and market needs to invest in the purchase of goods. That way, she doesn’t have many goods in stock, and she can sell them off rapidly.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy a wide range of goods in order to increase her income and support her husband.

loans.use: Purchase of basic foodstuffs to resell in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of pants and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods to restock a small grocery store

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a 50-year-old woman who struggles to improve her six children’s living conditions. To earn a living, she sells fried vegetables and fried chicken in her community. Santa has been running her business for more than ten years.

With her loan, Santa will buy a large amount of raw materials and other goods in order to expand her inventory and attract new clients. Santa hopes that someday she will have sufficient money to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and other goods to expand a small business

loans.name: Raphaël

texts.fr:
Mr. Raphaël H. was born around 1965 in Cotonou and is a married father of two children. He is a tailor by trade but also runs a parallel business of selling shirt and pants cloth and notions. He has also begun selling ready-to-wear pants and shirts that he makes himself and then sells to civil servants, who greatly value his work. As demand is growing and means are lacking, he is requesting a third loan to meet his customers’ needs and continue to satisfy their demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né vers 1965 à COTONOU, Monsieur H. Raphaël est marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est couturier de profession mais mène parallèlement à celle-ci la vente des tissus pantalons, chemises et des produits de mercerie. Actuellement il s’est lancé dans la vente des pantalons et chemises prêt- à –porter qu’il confectionne lui – même puis distribue à aux fonctionnaires qui apprécient bien son travail. La demande devenant de plus en plus grande et manquant de moyen, il sollicite pour sa troisième fois un crédit pour couvrir et satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of five rolls of pants cloth and five bales of shirts

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
Mrs. Françoise A. was born June 16, 1950 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow who takes care of four children, who all go to school. She is retired from her position at the Centre National Hospitalier et Universitaire Hubert Maga, the largest hospital in Benin. To keep up her previous standard of living, Mrs. Françoise A. began selling various foodstuffs, including bags of corn, beans and others. She is requesting her fourth loan to develop her business and meet her customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame Françoise A. est née le 16 juin 1950 à COTONOU, ville capitale économique du BENIN. Veuve elle a sa charge 4 enfants qui sont scolarisés. Elle est retraitée du Centre National Hospitalier et Universitaire Hubert MAGA, le plus grand centre hospitalier du BENIN. Pour être en harmonie avec son niveau de vie d’alors, dame Françoise A. s’est lancée dans la vente des produits vivriers divers et notamment des sacs de maïs, du haricots et autres. Elle sollicite ce quatrième crédit pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire la demande de la clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 bags of corn and various foodstuffs

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr:
Mrs. Anna Marie Oliveira was born July 26, 1967 in Cotonou and is a married mother of two children. She lives with her husband, an official with SOBREBRA, the state-controlled brewing and bottling company of Benin. Her principal business is selling various products such as wine, milk, sugar, pasta and others. Mrs. Oliveira’s shop is in Akpakpadodome, a working-class neighborhood in Cotonou. Her products are in high demand, so she is requesting a loan to increase her supplies and meet the ever-growing demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 26 juillet 1967 à COTONOU, dame D. Anne Marie est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle vit avec son mari qui est un agent de la Société Béninoise des Brasseries du BENIN (SOBEBRA). Elle a pour activité principale la vente de produits divers à savoir vin, lait, sucre, pâtes alimentaire et autres. Installée à AKPAKPADODOME l’un des quartiers de ville les plus populaire de COTONOU, dame D. est confrontée à une forte demande; ce qui l’a poussé à solliciter un prêt pour s’approvisionner et faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of boxed wine, cosmetics, pasta, boxed milk and other products

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr:
Mrs. Philomène M. was born November 18, 1969 in Cotonou and is a married mother of four children. She has a small, successful food stand at the Dantokpa market, the largest market in Benin. She is a woman with high moral standards who often jokes with her customers every time they visit her stand, and this makes them want to come back time and time again! She is requesting this loan to further develop her business and satisfy the growing demand of her customers, who praise the quality of her food. 

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 18 novembre 1969 à COTONOU, dame M. Philomène est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle excelle dans la petite restauration au marché DANTOKPA, le plus grand marché du BENIN. Elle est d'une très bonne moralité et ne manque pas très souvent de vous faire une bonne blague toutes les fois que vous  vous retrouvez devant son étalage pour manger; de quoi avoir envie de revenir manger chez elle une autre fois. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour développer son activité et satisfaire la demande croissante de clientèle qui apprécie la qualité de son repas.

loans.use: Purchase of ten bags of rice and five bags of beans

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es:
Ms. M. and her two children, which she supports on her own since she is divorced from her husband, are living in a rented house located on the Pioneros street, in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. Her business involves selling condiments and spices, which she buys in bulk and repackages into smaller packages to sell in grocery stores. She applied for this loan to help her increase capital for her business. Her previous credit history makes her qualified for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martínez y sus dos hijos (a los cuales mantiene sola ya que se divorció del marido) viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la calle Pioneros de la zona de San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. La actividad que realiza es la venta de condimentos, ella compra por arrobas, los envasa en bolsitas pequeñas y los vende en las tiendas de abarrotes. Solicita crédito para aumento de capital. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To help build up her business - incremental capital.  (FOMENTO A SU NEGOCIO. INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL)

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco lives in his father's house in the Ilo Puerto street which is in the Tupac Amaru area, in the city of La Paz. He was educated in hotel services (Escuela Hotelera) and worked on events by providing services, such as lunches to the Ministry of Defense. Later, with their savings, they put up a business in the city of El Alto, which is currently doing very well. This is why he left the ministry and now focuses on his own business. He is requesting a loan to purchase a "spiedera" machine (one of those that shows a chicken in a glass case) and to begin selling fast food at night. His previous credit history is what qualifies him as a good customer able to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El señor vive en casa de su padre, en la calle puerto Ilo de la zona Tupac Amaru de la Ciudad de La Paz. Cursó estudios en la Escuela Hotelera, trabajó atendiendo eventos y proveía un servicio de almuerzos al Ministerio de Defensa. Posteriormente, con sus ahorros puso un negocio en la Ciudad de El Alto al cuál le va muy bien, por eso dejó el Ministerio y ahora se dedica a su negocio. Solicita crédito para comprar una maquina spiedera (de esas que exhiben el pollo en una vitrina) y vender comida rápida durante la noche. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase machinery for his business. (ADQUISICIÓN DE MAQUINARIA PARA SU NEGOCIO)

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene lives with her parents on Kiswuarani street in the Alto Tacagua area of La Paz. She is a single mother and supports her daughter. She makes dough in order to make cakes, turnovers, tarts, etc. She subleased space in a store on Alcoreza street and there she displays her products and her business is going well and her customers are asking for more items. She is asking for a loan to expand her business and increase her income. Her previous credit history qualifies her as a good client and she can have a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Kiswuarani de la zona de Alto Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es madre soltera y mantiene a su hija. La actividad que realiza es la elaboración de masitas como ser pasteles, empanadas, tortas, etc., para esto alquiló una tienda trastienda en la calle Alcoreza, en este lugar expone sus productos y le va muy bien pero le piden mas cosas. Solicita crédito para ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Expand products and business

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Mrs Anastasia has a taco business. This business is their family’s source of income where both her and her husband work. We sell tacos in different places in the city of Nuevo Laredo. We would like to purchase a stand outside of our home and therefore be able to also take care of the children. I request a loan of US$1,200 to purchase a taco stand.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Anastasia tiene un negocio de tacos. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Nosotros vendemos tacos en diferentes partes de la Ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Queremos comprar un puesto para establecerlo fuera de la casa y así también cuidar a los niños. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de un puesto de tacos.

loans.use: Purchase a Stand to sell Tacos

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea Velis and her husband own their own home on the Huanta Street, in the Alto Chijini area, in the city of La Paz. Dorotea is 64 years of age and sells "cholita" footwear on Max Street. She has run this business from a very young age. Now she needs a loan for increasing her capital and to improve her income. Her husband is losing his sight, and she will have to run her household expenses on her own. Her credit history qualifies her as a good customer and with this she is able to get her new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Dorotea Velis y su esposo tienen vivienda propia en la calle Huanta, zona de Alto Chijini, ciudad de La Paz. La señora de 64 años de edad se dedica a vender calzados de cholita en la calle Max paredes. Ha mantenido este negocio desde muy joven. Ahora, solicita crédito para incrementar su capital y mejorar sus ingresos. Su esposo esta perdiendo la vista y ella mantendrá sola su hogar. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To increase her capital (INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL)

loans.name: Nora Bertha

texts.en:
I have had my business for 6 years. This is the source of income for my family. The business is comprised of selling new and used clothing in different areas in the city of Nuevo Laredo. I want to invest more into the business such as purchasing electronic devices and more merchandise. I request a loan of US$1,000 to purchase additional merchandise and electronic devices for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 6 años con el negocio. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. El negocio es la venta de ropa usada y nueva yo vendo en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Quiero invertirle más al negocio como aparatos electrónicos y más mercancía. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls, para la comprar de mercancía y aparatos electrónicos para tener más mercancía en el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and electronic devices

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery lives with her husband and children in her sister-in-law’s home, on Michel street in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz. She sells Avon cosmetic products and socks. She doesn’t have a store, but rather she sells on the street. Her husband works as a policeman in the American Embassy, but the wage is very low so she helps with her daily sales. She is asking for a loan to expand her business by buying other products and thereby be able to increase her income. Her previous credit history qualifies her as a good client and she can have a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora vive en casa de su cuñada, en el pasaje Michel de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos, se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (cosméticos) y calcetines. No tiene puesto fijo, deambula por la calle, el esposo trabaja como policía en la Embajada Americana, pero el sueldo es muy bajo por lo cual ella ayuda con sus ventas diarias. Solicita crédito para ampliar su negocio comprando otros productos y así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana has dedicated herself to selling carbonated beverages for many years. At 67 years of age, she’s a strong and capable entrepreneurial woman. She is the mother of 5 children that are all professionals with their own families. Now she enjoys the company of her dear husband in their humble aboD.. Together they would like to get ahead and succeed selling carbonated beverages and expand their business to sell groceries. For Mrs. Juana everything is possible and this is the reason she’s asking for your help to start expanding her business soon. Juana needs the help of your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Juana se dedica a la venta D. bebidas gasificadas desD. hace mucho tiempo, ella a sus 67 años D. edad se muestra como una mujer fuerte y muy decidida en el ámbito comercial, es madre D. 05 hijos los mismos que ya son profesionales y han conformado sus propias familias, quedando sola gozando D. la compañía D. su querido esposo en su humilD. morada. Juntos quieren salir adelante y tener éxito con la venta D. bebidas gasificadas y también quieren implementar su negocio con la venta D. abarrotes.Para la señora Juana no todo es posible y por esa razón recurre en búsqueda D. tu ayuda para cumplir su propósito dentro D. poco tiempo.Juana necesita la ayuda desinteresada D. tu noble corazón.

loans.use: To start her business.

loans.name: Edil

texts.es:
Mr. Edil is 37 years old and is an active man. He is a primary school teacher and father to two beautiful little girls, Nicolle and Shesira, that are the lights of his life. With the intention of improving their quality of life, as an additional source of income he drives a taxi. With this side job he has greatly improved his family’s economic situation and is very content. However, the past couple of months he hasn’t been able to drive his taxi due to mechanical problems with his mode of transportation. For this reason, this humble family man wishes to fix his taxi in order to return to his usual work routine. With your help, this young father will be able to realize his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Edil de 37 años de edad es un hombre activo, de profesión maestro de educación primaria, él es padre de dos hermosas nenas Nicolle y Shesira, quienes son la luz de su progreso. Con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida de manera adicional se dedica a prestar sus servicios de movilidad en su mototaxi, con este oficio adicional ha mejorado mucho la situación económica de su familia y está muy contento; sin embargo hace un para de meses no puede ejercer esta labor como de costumbre porque ha tenido serios desperfectos en su herramienta de trabajo.Por esa razón este humilde padre de familia desea mejorar las condiciones de su mototaxi para que pronto vuelva a su rutina de trabajo habitual. Con vuestra ayuda este joven padre podrá concretar sus deseos.

loans.use: To buy parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila sells beer and soft drinks. Since she provides her clients with great service and hospitality, she has decided to expand and implement her business so that her clients feel at ease. Lila is 57 years old and has 6 children who are all independent and have their own families. Her husband, Melvin, is an independent worker and encourages her to continue with her business and move ahead with her plans. But, for Lila to be able expand and implement her business, she needs capital. With your help, Lila will reach her objective in no time.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lila, se dedica a la venta D. cervezas y gaseosas, ella por su buena atención y acogida, se ha plasmado un propósito, ampliar e implementar su negocio para que sus clientes se sientan a gusto. Lila a sus 57 años D. edad, tiene 06 hijos los mismos que ya se independizaron y poseen sus propias familias. Su esposo el señor Melvin, quien es trabajador independiente, la incentiva a seguir con este negocio y que salga adelante.Sin embargo Lila para ampliar e implementar su negocio necesariamente requiere D. un capital para lograr su propósito. Con tu ayuda la señora Lila logrará su objetivo en corto tiempo.

loans.use: To start her business.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es:
The only reason Magnolia has been selling ice cold drinks (beer and soft drinks) for a long time, is because her husband used to work in a well-known brewery in her region. Everything was going well with the business until the day her husband, Julio, fell seriously ill and they had to make significant expenditures for treatment and to help him recuperate. At 43 years of age, Magnolia is the mother of 2 children and for them, she has become confident and capable of moving ahead in her life. To achieve her objective, she needs a loan as soon as possible. Let's help Magnolia make it, she won't fail you.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Magnolia se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas(cervezas y gaseosas) desde hace tiempo, por única razón de que su esposo trabajaba años atrás en una empresa cervecera reconocida de su región. Todo marchaba muy bien en su negocio hasta que un día su esposo el señor Julio se enfermó de gravedad y tuvieron que hacer gastos muy significativos por el tratamiento que lo ayudaría a recobrar su salud. La señora Magnolia a sus 42 años es madre de dos hijos es por ello que se muestra como una mujer decidida y capaz de salir adelante. Para cumplir con este objetivo ella necesita de un capital de inversión lo más pronto posible. Ayudemos a la señora Magnolia a seguir adelante, ella no te defraudará.

loans.use: To implement her business.

loans.name: Dolibe

texts.es:
Dolibe adds taste and color to her homemaD. sweets, which she makes at home with much effort and love. She then sells her baked goods in different parts of town. She is the mother of 3 children, 2 who now have their own families and the youngest daughter, Paola, with whom she lives. Her daughter supports her and helps out with the business as she herself prepares to go to university. Dolibe wants her daughter to be a successful professional and that's why she works hard at this job and in addition, provides a service to her community by having a small food store which she wants to expand. In order to implement and expand this store, she needs a loan. She awaits the generous help of your noble heart.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabor y color es lo que le da a sus productos D. dulces la señora Dolibe, quien con mucho esfuerzo y amor los prepara y hornea para luego llevarlos a vender a los diferentes lugares D. su zona. Ella es madre D. tres hijos D. las cuales dos D. ellos ya han cinstruido sus propias familias, quedando sola con la compañía D. la última D. sus hijas D. nombre Paola, quien también la apoya mucho en la preparación D. sus dulces y quien también se prepara para postular a la universidad. La señora Dolibe quiere que su hija Paola se convierta en una profesional D. éxito, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho en este trabajo y adicionalmente también presta servicios a su comunidad a través D. su pequeño negocio D. venta D. abarrotes(bodega) el cual falta implementar, para lograr el objetivo D. su implementación requiere D. un capital D. inversión.Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada D. tu noble corazón.

loans.use: To start her business and buy food products.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa offers electronic repair services alongside her husband, Marco Antonin. Together they repair electronic items like radios and televsions. She is 32 years old and her 3 children have become her life's purpose. As well, she has a part-time job as a cook in a popular cevichería (raw, marinated seafood specialty restaurant) in the city. But, this doesn't mean she doesn't take care of her children, she actually plans time for them and everything else, and because of this, considers herself Super Mom! Rosa wants to grow her electronics business by buying material and hardware and asks for a loan that will help her to improve her finanacial resources and realize her objective. WIth your help, Rosa will achieve her goals.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa brinda los servicios de electrónica, en compañía de su esposo, Marco Antonio, juntos se dedican a realizar reparaciones de artefactos electrodomésticos, radios y televisores.Ella a sus 32 años de edad es madre de 03 hijos que están estudiando y se han convertido en la razón de su vida. De manera adicional y temporalmente brinda sus servicios de cocinera en una cevichería muy concurrida de su ciudad, pero eso no implica dejar de atender a sus hijos ya que ella planifica su tiempo para todo y en consecuencia se considera una súper mamá. Doña Rosa sólo quiere crecer con su negocio es por ello que quiere comprar mayor cantidad de materiales para implementar su negocio electrónico y solicita de un capital de inversión que la ayudará a mejorar su sustento económico y a lograr su objetivo. Con tu ayuda la señora Rosa logrará lo que se ha propuesto.

loans.use: To buy bigger quantities of material and hardware so she can provide a better repair service to her clients.

loans.name: Agustín

texts.en:
Agustin H. Correa is a successful father of four healthy school age children. He works very hard to give them a good life and keep them in school. Seven years ago he opened a small grocery store from the house, which he owns. His wife Adelaida runs the store on a daily basis now.
