Putu Purnamayanti saat ini sedang menekuni usaha warung yang khusus menjual makanan tradisional seperti berbagai macam kue khas Bali. Selain itu juga berbagai macam makanan dan minuman ringan yang sangat digemari oleh warga sekitar tempat tinggalnya. Untuk modal awal Purnamayanti mempergunakan tabungan mereka. Sekarang ini Purnamayanti mendapatkan tambahan modal usaha dari DINARI yang dipergunakan untuk modal berdagang. Setiap hari Purnamayanti menghabiskan modal warung Rp.100,000,-dan pendapatan kotornya Rp.150.000,- jadi keuntungan bersihnya Rp.50,000,- Putu Purnamayanti sangat bersyukur ada pinjaman modal dari Dinari sehingga ia bisa mengembangkan usahanya.

loans.use: Renovate kiosk and increase product offering

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang S., 40, is a mother of three and works as a housewife cooking food for her family. Her husband is a soldier earning less than 1 USD each day. Two of her children work at a construction site and generally earn $2 each day and one of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Mrs. Heang S. hopes to use this loan to repair the roof on her house in order to prevent leaking during the rainy season which will help her save money and better her and her family’s lives.

loans.use: to repair her house roof in order to prevent from leaking during a rainy season.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Heang Sokhom start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Muguluka West C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mwamimi K.. She is currently in the business of selling sugar wax and is requesting a loan to expand business. Mwamimi is 40 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 8 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Mwamimi makes approximately UGX 45000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start another business. Mwamimi has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to improve business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mwamimi is joined in her small group by Rava N., Edith K., Sarah K., and Jane K.. Rava N. has a business selling sugar wax and wants to boost business. Edith K. is currently operating a business selling sugar wax and wants a loan to add to the business. Sarah K. operates a business as a bar attendant and wants to add to the business. Jane K. is currently in the business of operating a hotel and is requesting a loan to purchase more food and other hotel equipment.

loans.use: To add to sugar business

loans.name: Samina  Sehar's Group

texts.en:
My name Samina Sehar A. and I have lived all my life in Multan, a mid-sized city in Pakistan. I own a three-room house here in Multan where I live with my husband and four children: two girls and two boys. Two of my children are older than 15 and two are still quite young. I have run a boutique for many years, and also create embroidered outfits, which my brother sells in the big city of Karachi, Pakistan. For every dress I make, I earn a profit of about $2 to $3. I want to expand my business so that I can improve my income and repair my house.

I lead a loan group whose members are: Hafeezan M., who will use the loan to buy her son a rickshaw. Rehmat B. sells paper and Hajra B. sells cloth and paper; both need new items to sell. All of these women are mutually responsible for the loan; if one does not pay, the others will pay for her.

loans.use: To expand four small businesses

loans.name: Muguluka West Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hasifa N.. She is currently in the business of selling sugar wax and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Hasifa is 30 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 5 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Hasifa makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more into her business. Hasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hasifa is joined in her small group by Hadija M., Lovisa N., and Madinah S.. Hadija M. has a business selling sugar wax and wants to add more capital. Lovisa N. is currently operating a business as a bar attendant and wants a loan to start another business. Madinah S. operates a business selling sugar wax and wants to boost business to increase profits.

loans.use: To expand sugar wax business

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
Barno K. lives in J.Rasulov, Tajikistan. She is married and has three children.

Barno is engaged in commercial service and trade. She sells socks, women's underwear and men's wear. Having a good assortment, she has many repeat customers. Now she is applying for a business development loan for purchasing a new stock of underwear.

loans.use: Purchasing new underwear stock.

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Mrs. Khin S., 28, is married with two little children. She works at home to feed her family, while her husband drives a motor-taxi.  He typically makes about 5 dollars each day. Mrs. Khin S. would like to request a loan to purchase a new motor-bike for her husband, because his old motor-bike is broken beyond repair. Mrs. Khin S. is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a new motor-bike for her husband to operate a businesss.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Khin Socheat start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Muguluka West E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Kate L.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Kate is 20 years old and is single. She has 1 child aged 2. Each week, Kate makes approximately UGX 8000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to improve business and educate her children. Kate has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Kate is joined in her small group by Halima M., Janat K. and Madinah M.. Halima M. has a business selling sugar wax and wants to increase working capital. Janat K. is currently operating a business selling chapatis and wants a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, cooking oil and onions. Madinah M. operates a business selling sugar wax and wants to add to her sugar wax business.

loans.use: To increase the stock of clothes sold

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
I am Mussarat B. and I have lived all my life in Multan, a city famous in Pakistan for its shrines. I am married and the mother of four: three boys and one girl. We live in a two-room brick-mud house here in Multan. My daughter creates beautiful embroidered dresses, which her aunt sells in the big city of Karachi. We plan to use our portion of the loan to expand her business, and will use the profits as her dowry.

I lead a group of four other women who have applied for a loan: Nighat B., Bushra B., Parween B. and Saeedan B.. Nighta B. and Bushra B. both are textile designers who embroider clothes. Saeedan B. runs a beauty shop. Parween B. needs this loan for her stitching business. All these women are hard working entrepreneurs and dream of providing better lives for their families.

loans.use: To expand five small businesses

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan P., 31, works with her husband making ice cream to sell.  They collectively make around $11 each day in revenue. They have been in the business since 2002. Mrs. Yan P. and her husband would like to purchase more tools to produce cold bubble tea to meet her growing customer demand. This will enable her to keep her profit up and bring her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to make ice cream

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz A. is a 47-year-old man who owns a small business in the small village of Saatli region. He sells milk and dairy products to the neighbors and to local bazaar traders. He is married and has three children. He has ten years of experience in this field.

It is very hard to find a job in the village, or in the region in general. Mubariz and his wife are unemployed. Selling dairy products is the only source of income in their family. Mubariz has found a solution to improve his family's life conditions. He would like to purchase one milk cow , a calf, and fodder. The estimated cost for the cow is $700 USD, plus $400 USD for the calf. The rest, $100 USD, he is going to spend on fodder.

loans.use: To purchase one cow, one calf and fodder

loans.name: Dinh Dung

texts.vi:
Mr. Dung, 51 years old, has 2 children that are going to work. He and his wife are hard-working, and caring for their family. Besides selling goods in the marker, they also breed animals and grow vegetables at home. Their current daily income is 7.5 USD/ day. They never borrowed money from any agencies. Since they know about the weekly repayment of Binh Minh CDC Microeconomic Program, they want to borrow 150 USD to buy seeds, pesticides to increase the productivity of growing vegetables.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Anh Dũng, 51 tuổi, có hai con đã đi làm. Vợ chồng anh chị là người chăm chỉ, biết cách chu toàn, vun vén gia đình. Ngoài công việc bán hàng ở chợ, anh chị còn tăng gia sản xuất ở nhà như chăn nuôi và trồng rau. Mức thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình cũng lên tới 120000đồng. Anh chị chưa từng tham gia vay vốn ở đâu. Được biết tới hình thức trả góp hàng tuần rất thuận tiện của chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc, anh chị đã vay 2006000đồng để mua cây giống, thuốc trừ sâu, phục vụ cho việc trồng rau của gia đình.

loans.use: buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
A. Zaur is 30-year old farmer who has been breeding calves and selling milk since 2003. He lives with his family in a small village of Saatli Region. He is unemployed, and farming is the only one source of income in this family.

Mr. Zaur tries very hard, and meat and milk are in high demand all across Azerbaijan. People in Azerbaijan use meat in almost in every meal. Since last year, the prices for these products increased by five times, and now, keeping a family in good conditions is not very easy. Mr. Zaur decided to expand his business and purchase three additional calves for breeding and a fodder. For this purpose, he applied for $1100 USD.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Muguluka West F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Juliet N.. She is currently in the business of selling old clothes and is requesting a loan to increase working capital. Juliet is a widow. Each week, Juliet makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build better business premises. Juliet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Juliet is joined in her small group by Faridah B., Sanyu N. and Juliet N.. Faridah B. has a pharmacy business and wants to purchase more drugs to sell. Sanyu N. is currently operating a business selling sugar wax and wants a loan to add to the business. Juliet N. operates a retail shop business and wants to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To expand clothes business and make more profits

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en:
A. Aqil is a 27-year-old young businessman who keeps a cow in a small village of Saatli region. He is married and has three children. He started his business in 2004, when he was just a young boy and, since that time, he has sold yoghurt and milk to the neighbors.

Mr. Aqil's clients knows him very well and he is very polite to them. Sometimes, all of his milk is sold, but clients are still coming and knocking at the door and asking Aqil to sell them a liter of milk. Expanding his business will bring him good income and he will be able to keep his children in good condition. He needs $1000 USD to purchase an additional milk cow and baby calf.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one baby calf

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: A. Natiq is a 32-year-old man who sells milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders. He is married and has three children. He has six years of experience in this field.  He would like to expand his business buying four calves for an estimated cost of $300 USD each. He is going to start selling calves for meat production.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Chhung

texts.en: Mrs. Chung R. is a mother of one school-aged child.  She works at the Mithy Khorn massage parlor, making $3 each day. Her husband is a tuk-tuk driver and earns about $5 per day. Mrs. Chung R. requests a loan to buy a motor-bike to commute to work.  The rest of the money will be used to buy a plot of land on which she will build her house. This will provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to eventually build her house

loans.name: Muguluka West G Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mwajuma M.. She is currently in the business of selling second hand clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Mwajuma is 35 years old and is a widow. She has 8 children ranging from age 6 to 23 and all of them go to school. Each week, Mwajuma makes approximately UGX 13000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to improve business. Mwajuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mwajuma is joined in her small group by Zulaika N. and Hadija N.. Zulaika N. has a business selling sugar wax and wants to add capital and boost business. Hadija N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to increase stock in her shop.

loans.use: To boost clothing business

loans.name: Antiqa

texts.en: Antiqa A. is a 57-year-old  woman who has sold milk to the her neighbors for the past  ten years. She is married and has four children. Antiqa and her husband are unemployed. It is very hard to maintains such a big family and Antiqa decided to broaden her business by purchasing more milk cows and starting to sell milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders. It will increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family. She has applied for $1200 USD to purchase two cows for $600 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman B. is a 55-year-old farmer who owns a small market in the IDP Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. He has run his business since 1995. He sells various kind of goods, beverages and stationery. Elman's store is the only financial source in his family. The income is just enough to cover basic family needs, but not enough to improve his business. He has a very big demand for the products he sells. That’s why he has applied for $900 USD to increase the number of products in his store.

loans.use: To increase the number of products in his store

loans.name: Thi Hao

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hao, 49 years old, has 2 children who are carpenters. Her husband passed away, therefore, she had to raise her children on her own. Fortunately, her children are loving and dutiful. Her family income is 4.4 – 5 USD/ day. These days, since her 2 children are going into the workforce, she only stays at home to breed the pigs, increasing family income. She never borrowed money from other agencies because of complicated paperwork. However, since she knows the convenience of Binh Minh CDC Microeconomic Program, she wants to borrow 150 USD to buy pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Hảo, 49 tuổi, có 2 con đang làm thợ mộc. Chồng mất, một mình chị chăm lo, nuôi dưỡng các con. Được cái, các con chị ngoan ngoãn, thương yêu mẹ và chăm lo cho gia đình. Thu nhập gia đình chị từ 70000-80000đồng một ngày. Giờ, hai con chị đã đi làm, chị chỉ cần ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu vì thấy thủ tục rất phức tạp, nhưng từ khi được biết tới sự thuận lợi của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc, chị đã vay 2006000đồng để mua cám cho lợn.

loans.use: buy pig mash

loans.name: Anver

texts.en: Anver B. is a 60-year-old farmer who sells milk to the local bazaar traders in a small village in Saatli region. He is married and has three children. It is very hard to keep a family in reasonable condition when you are unemployed, and his only source of income is selling milk and yoghurt. Anver has more than ten years of experience in this field, and last year, the price of goods increased by five times (500%), so keeping only one cow is not enough to maintain such a large family. Anver has decided to expand his dairy business by purchasing one milk cow for $700 USD.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap Chaum , 27, has been married for seven years and has two daughters. She is in the business of selling vegetables. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor last year. She sells her produce in Phnom Penh where her husband, Yang Makara, runs a motor taxi. After seven years in business, he wants to buy a remoque carriage to expand his service. Motor Remorque is popular for transporting goods and people in Cambodia. It can carry 20-25 people. Both husband and wife hope to continue to grow their businesses so they can support their children’s studies.

They are requesting their first loan in the amount of $1000. It will be used to purchase a Remorque carriage for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a remoque carriage

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
Shamil J. is a 50-year-old man who breeds calves in the small village of Saatli region. He purchases baby calves, raise them, and sells them to the local bazaar traders for meat production. He has seven years of experience in this field.

Shamil need to expand his business and to purchase more caves, because the demand for meat is very high in Azerbaijan. He needs $1200 USD to purchase one milk cow for $600 USD and two calves for an estimated cost $300 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Sib

texts.en: Mrs. Sib P., 40, runs a stand at a busy market selling a variety of fresh vegetables.  She typically makes around $5 each day in revenue. Her husband has worked as a motor-taxi driver since 2000. He transport passengers from place to place and generally makes on average around $5 each day in income. Mrs. Sib P. will use this loan to buy a new motor-bike to replace her husband's old one, which needs to be regularly repaired at a high cost.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor-bike for her husband to operate a business

loans.name: Ken

texts.en: Mrs. Ken M., 28, is a mother of two children. She works as a garment worker and makes on average around $2 a day in profit. She also earns additional money by renting out rooms to workers. Her husband, Mr. But Tol, 40, works as a security guard makes $8 in income daily. Both of their children are students. Now, this couple is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva to renovate their house as their house is too old. The rest of the money will be used to buy a car.

loans.use: to renovate their house and purchase a car

loans.name: Damirali

texts.en: Damirali D. is a 55-year-old farmer who keeps a cow and sells milk and yoghurt in a small village of Saatli region. He has more than ten years of experience in  this business. He is married and has four children. Dairy products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan. Damirali decided to increase his income and has applied for $1100 USD. With this loan, he is going to purchase two baby calves for $200 USD and two calves for an estimated cost of $300 USD each and fodder for the rest 100 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase two calves and two baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Rahib

texts.en: Rahib D. is a 30-year-old farmer who sells milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders. He is married and  has three children. He started selling dairy products to his neighbors first, and only later, he started selling milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders. Now he would like to expand his business and start breeding calves for meat production. He chose this business, because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use meat almost every day. Rahib applied for $900 USD to purchase three calves for $300 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin H. , 34, has been married for sixteen years and has one son who is studying in primary school. Currently, she and her husband, Hem Socheat, are in the business of spinning thread with a semi-machine for a scarf producer in the village. It’s a skill they learned from their neighbor. Both husband and wife hope to continue to grow their business so they can support their son’s studies.

Mrs. H. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $600. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Brok

texts.en: Mrs. Brok S., 36, is married and has three children.  She works selling rice and porridge in Srass Chor commune in the city of Phnom Penh.  She earns around $10 of profit per day. Her husband, Mr. Chan Seng, is a motor-taxi driver and makes on average $10 of income daily. Three of their children are students. This couple needs a loan of $1200 as a capital to purchase a new car.  Their current car is too old and uses a lot of gas.

loans.use: to change a new motor

loans.name: Sman

texts.en:
Mr. Sman L. , 37, has been married for sixteen years and has three children-- two sons and one daughter. All of them are studying in the local school. He and his family live approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. L. is in the business of fishing and selling Prohok while his wife has been selling Chinese noodles for five years. Prohok is made from fish and is a favorite food of Cambodians. Mr. L. learned his skill from his parents as a young boy. Both husband and wife hope to continue to grow their businesses so they can support their children’s studies.

He is requesting his fifth loan in the amount of $700. He will use this money to purchase ingredients needed for making Prohok.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for Prohok

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer A. is a 43-year-old trader who owns a small men's clothing store in the small village Qaranuru in Saatli region. He has four years of experience in this field. He always has clients who come to buy a suit, but client demand is higher than the number of suits he has to sell. The money he makes from selling clothes is just enough to keep his family in normal living conditions.

To increase number of products he sells, he needs more funds. He has applied for $1200 USD. With this loan, he will be able to purchase more than 20 suits, which can help him to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase 20 or more suits to expand his business

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthol S. lives on the way to Ankor Wat, approximately eighteen kilometers form Phnom Penh. She was married in 1984 to Bauy Ty. They have five sons and three daughters. Three of their children have full time employment and the others are studying in in local school.

Mrs. S. and her husband have had a vegetable garden for 24 years. They sell the produce in a market in Phnom Penh. They are polite and friendly and wish to set up a grocery store for their daughter to sell food in the village market.

Mrs. S. is requesting her third loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to increase the vegetable production in the family's garden.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetable plants

loans.name: Heydarali

texts.en: Heydarali A. is a 33-year-old trader who sells cloths in Fatalikend village of Saatli region. He started his business in 2005. Heydarali is married and has three children. He has applied for $1200 USD  to diversify the clothes he sells.

loans.use: Going to diversify clothes he sells

loans.name: Muguluka West H Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mary N.. She is currently in the business of running a hotel and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Mary is 43 years old and is married. Her husband is a carpenter. She has 7 children ranging from age 8 to 22 and all of them go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately UGX 12000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in the business. Mary has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Mary is joined in her small group by Margret N., Hasifa N., and Edisa N.. Margret N. has a business running a drug shop and wants to purchase more drugs to sell. Hasifa N. is currently operating a business selling sugar wax and wants a loan to uplift business. Edisa N. operates a business selling sugar wax and wants to expand business.

loans.use: To add to hotel business

loans.name: Ng

texts.en: Mrs. Ng Y., 46, is a widow who lives with her three children.  She works as a health officer in Kampong Cham province, where she earns on average about $4 a day of profit. Three of her children are married but still live in her house. One of her daughters is a vendor of grocery products. Concerns had been raised because the cost of daily expenses is too high. Mrs. Ng Y. is requesting a loan from Kiva for $800 to expand her business by purchasing more grocery products for her daughter. The rest of the money will be used to buy a car for Mrs. Ng Y.’s commute.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products and a car

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela Ngumia is 35 years old. She is married and has three children, who are aged 11, 14, and 16.

In 2006, Angela established a clothing business. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

Angela thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Sles

texts.en:
Mr. Sles L. lives on the way to Ankor Wat, approximately eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He was married in 1979 to Yeb Maismas. They have five sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. His wife and the other children work in the family fishing business. Mr. L. has been fishing in the Mekong River since he was a young boy. It’s a skill he learned from his parents.

Mr. L. is requesting his second loan in the amount of $800. He will use this money to purchasing fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en: Mahammad A. is a 51-year-old man who raises cows and sells milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders. He is married and has four children. They live together in the small village of Saatli region. Mahammad would like to expand his business and start breeding calves, because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people eat meat almost every day. For this purpose, he applied for $1200 USD, With this loan, he will purchase four calves for $300 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur A. is a 27-year-old farmer who sells milk and dairy products to the local people. He has three years of experience in this field. He applied for $1200 USD to purchase two milk cows, one for $500 USD and the second for an estimated cost of $600 USD.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Busiya East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock. Harriet is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children ranging from age 3 months to 5 years, and four of them go to school. Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to improve her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Racheal N., Scovia N., Zaituni B., and Emiranda N.. Racheal N. has a business in trading chicken feed and wants to increase working capital. Scovia N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to boost business. Zaituni B. operates a restaurant business and wants to purchase more raw food and utensils. Emiranda N. is currently in the business of wholesale coffee trading and is requesting a loan to add to her coffee business.

loans.use: To increase stock in the shop

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz A. is a 51-year-old trader who sells food in his small food store in IDPs Settlement of Bilasuvar region. He started his business in 2007. Now he needs $1200 USD loan to purchase two milk cows for $600 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Mirkhadi

texts.en: Mirkhadi A. is a 52-year-old baker who has a bakery in the small village of Saatli region. He started his business in 2001 and since then, it brings him good income. He has applied for $1000 USD to improve the conditions in his workplace.

loans.use: To improve conditions in his workplace

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em S., 34, is a garment worker earns around $2 a day in profit. Her husband, Mr. Cheu Sina, 31, works as a construction laborer and makes on average $6 a day in income. This couple has three children, all of whom are students. They are now requesting a loan form Kiva for $300 to purchase a car for their commute. They currently ride a motor-taxi to work and it costs them a lot.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a car.

loans.name: Busiya East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to uplift business and make more profits. Sarah is 33 years old and is married. She has s 4 children ranging from age to and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and sustain them financially. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to improve business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Rose N., Monic N., and Rose N.. Sarah N. has a business in selling used clothes and wants to expand business. Rose N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to purchase more clothes for sale. Monic N. operates a business of sugar wax and wants to boost business. Rose N. is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling.

loans.use: To add in clothe business and improve it

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib K. is a 49-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and three children in the small village of Saatli region. He has eight years of experience in farming. Now he needs $1100 USD to purchase one cow for $600 USD and two baby calves for an estimated $250 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two baby calves

loans.name: Narman

texts.en: Narman L. is a 46-year-old farmer who has raised calves for breeding since 1998. He lives in a small village of Saatli region. He is married and has five children. Narman and his wife are unemployed, and selling calves for meat production is their only source of income. He would like to broaden his business by purchasing three additional calves for an estimated cost of $300 USD each, and by purchasing fodder with the remaining $100 USD. For this purpose, he applied for $1000 USD.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. Thol C. ,42, has been married since 1985 and has five children--two sons and three daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives outside the family house, one of her sons is working as a blacksmith with her husband, and the other three children are studying in the local school.

Mrs. C. is in the business of charging batteries for the past year. Meanwhile, her husband has been a blacksmith for eighteen years. It’s a skill he learned in the city of Phnom Penh. They hope that their businesses will continue to support the family and allow their younger children to continue in school.

She is requesting a loan in the amount $1000 for the fifth time, to purchase blacksmith materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials

loans.name: Busiya East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Justine M.. She is currently in the business of retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items. Justine is 24 years old and is married with a husband who is a wholesaler of coffee, maize and beans. She has 2 children ranging from age 3 months to 5 and only one goes to school. Each week, Justine makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build herself a house. Justine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to improve business and the loan was paid back on time.

Justine is joined in her small group by Margret K., Harriet N., Faridah N., and Ruth L.. Margret K. has a business in chicken selling and wants to improve business. Harriet N. is currently operating a business in chicken rearing and wants a loan to purchase chicken feeds. Faridah N. operates a business of selling maize and wants to boost business. Ruth L. is currently in the business of retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase another fridge and increase stock.

loans.use: To increase the stock in retail shop and boost business

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong H., 30, works growing vegetables and rice crops, earning about $1 each day from selling her vegetables to a nearby market. Her husband is a soldier and spends the rest of his time helping to cultivate the crops. This couple has two little children; one is too young to attend school and the other is a primary school student. Mrs. Hong H. would like to increase her family’s income by increasing her outputs. Regrettably, her piece of farmland is too small to grow additional crops. After hearing about CREDIT MFI from one of her neighbors, she made a quick decision to ask for a loan of $500 to purchase another piece of farmland to use for her crop expansion. This will bring her and her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase another piece of land to grow crops

loans.name: Nhom Chi Xuyen - Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Xuyen, 57 years old, sells vegetables in the village central market. Besides, her family also works on rice field and breed pigs. Her two children are both going to work. Therefore, her family current income is pretty stable, approximately 6.25-7.5 USD/day. She wants to borrow money to buy more pig mash. Mrs. N. Thi Loan borrows money to buy pigs. Mrs. N. Thi Trang, Mrs. N. Thi Muon, Mrs. N. Thi Nga borrow money to buy pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Xuyên, 57 tuổi, buôn bán rau ở chợ trung tâm làng. N.ài ra, gia đình chị còn làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn. Chị có hai con đều đã đi làm, vì vậy thu nhập gia đình chị khá ổn định, khoảng 100000-120000đồng/ngày. Chị vay vốn để thêm vốn mua cám cho lợn ăn. Chị Ngô Thị Loan vay vốn mua lợn giống Chị Ngô Thị Trang, Chị Nguyễn Thị Muộn, Chị Ngô Thị Nga, đều vay vốn để mua cám cho lợn ăn, tăng gia sản xuất.

loans.use: buy pigs and pig mash

loans.name: Ibadet

texts.en: Ibadet M. is a 43-year-old man who breeds calves for meat production. He lives in a small village of Saatli region and has run this business since 2000. He applied for $1100 USD to purchase one milk cow for $700 USD and two baby calves for $200 USD each. He is going to start selling milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders and increase his meat production business.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two baby calves

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun N. , 43, and her husband, Phum Pheary, were married in 1985. They have seven children; two sons and five daughters. Her family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Four of their children are selling flowers, two are studying, and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. N. has been in the business of growing and selling rose and jasmine flowers since 2000. She purchases them in her village and resells them in the city of Phnom Penh. Her husband is a construction worker and farmer. They hope that their occupations will continue to support the family and allow their children to continue in school.

Mrs. N. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for traveling to Phnom Penh and for purchasing additional flowers for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and flowers for resale

loans.name: Busiya East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hafusa N.. She is currently in the business of maize milling and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Hafusa is 24 years old and is married. Her husband is a mechanic. She has 2 children aged 5 and 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Hafusa makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house and financially support the children. Hafusa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX s00000 in order to improve her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hafusa is joined in her small group by Amina N. and Hellen K.. Amina N. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to expand to bulk selling. Hellen K. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase the stock of clothes.

loans.use: To expand maize business

loans.name: Busiya East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is M. Getrude. She is currently in the business of selling used clothing and is requesting a loan to expand business. M. is 35 years old and is a widow. She has 1 school going daughter, aged 18. Each week, M. makes approximately UGX 9000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her child and add to her business. M. has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

M. is joined in her small group by Janet N., Toffu N. and Edith M.. Janet N. has a business selling sugar wax and wants to add more working capital. Toffu N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase the stock of clothes. Edith M. operates a business of selling used clothes and wants to boost business.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Busiya East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret K.. She is currently in the business of chicken rearing and is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed. Margret is 43 years old and is a widow with five children. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 28000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build better business premises. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Florence N., Lovis M. and Olivia N.. Florence N. has a business in sugar cane growing and wants to add to her business. Lovis M. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase the stock of clothes. Olivia N. operates a business of sugar wax selling and wants to add more capital.

loans.use: To expand poultry business and also improve quality of chicken

loans.name: Nhom Chi Thuy - Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thuy, 31 years old, has 2 children who are going to school. Her main activity is breeding pigs. Her husband does rice-husking and works on rice field. Her average income is 6.25 USD/day. She wants to borrow 150 USD to buy more pig mash. Mrs. P. Thi Hoa, wants to do vendoring activity. Mrs. N. Thi Ha wants to buy more duck-feed. Mrs. C. Thi Lam borrows money to sell dried food. Mrs. N. Thi Tan wants to buy wasted-metal material.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thuý, 31 tuổi, có hai con đang đi học. Chị làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn. Chồng chị làm nghề xát gạo và làm ruộng. Thu nhập trung bình của chị khoảng 100000 đồng/ ngày. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn chăn nuôi lợn (mua thức ăn cho lợn). Cô Phạm Thị Hoà vay vốn để bán hàng xén. Chị Ngô Thị Hà vay vốn để mua cám và thức ăn cho vịt. Chị C. Thị Lâm vay vốn để bán hàng khô. Chị Ngô Thị Tân vay vốn để đi chợ sắt.

loans.use: breeding animals , vendoring, food shop, buy wasted material

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun B., 43, and her husband, Moul Klat, have been married since 1990. They have three sons. Their oldest son sells flowers and other two are studying in the local school. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. B. has been growing and selling jasmine flowers since 2000. Her husband is a construction worker and a farmer. Both husband and wife hope that their businesses will be able to support the family and enable their children to continue their studies. She is requesting her fourth loan in the amount of $900. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike to travel to Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Busiya East F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet K.. She is currently in the business of wholesale rice selling and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of rice. Annet is 25 years old and is single. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 32000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business. Annet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Annet is joined in her small group by Getu N. and Harriet N.. Getu N. has a business in sugar cane growing and wants to add to her business. Harriet N. is currently operating a sugar wax business and wants a loan to improve and expand business.

loans.use: To add to rice business and boost it for better profits

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea Y. , 35, and her husband, Min Saray, have been married since 1994. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. Three of their children are studying in the local school and the youngest child stays at home. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Y. is in the business of growing jasmine and selling fruits and flowers at a Phnom Penh market. Her husband has worked in the construction business since 2001. Both husband and wife hope that their businesses will continue to support the family and allow their children to continue their schooling.

Mrs. Y. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase construction materials for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. E. Sophal, 59, is a widow with six children; four sons and two daughters. Mrs. Sophal and her family live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home. The other two children sell flowers and clothing.

Mrs. Sophal has also been in the business of selling flowers and second-hand clothes since 1995. She buys her clothes in Phnom Penh for resale in the village. Mrs. Sophal also buys jasmine flowers under contract from a farmer in her village for her daughter to sell in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting her fifth loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to expand the business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Miss C. Sopheap, 32, is single and lives with her widowed mother. She is the oldest daughter and has one sister and six brothers. Her sister is selling flowers while four of her brothers are farmers. The other two brothers are studying in the local school. Her mother raises pigs. Sopheap started her business of selling flowers in 1990. She purchases flowers from a farmer in her village to sell in Phnom Penh.

Miss Sopheap and her family live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She hopes that her business will enable her brothers to continue their studies to the highest level possible.

Miss Sopheap is requesting her second loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike to travel to Phnom Penh and sell her flowers.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Busiya East G Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jamawa M.. She is currently in the business of wholesale rice selling and is requesting a loan to stock more rice to sell. Jamawa is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a coffee trader. She has 2 children aged 8 and 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Jamawa makes approximately UGX 31000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and boost business. Jamawa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jamawa is joined in her small group by Zulaika N., Zamu N. and Catherine B.. Zulaika N. has a business in goat rearing and wants to buy more goats. Zamu N. is currently operating a business selling bananas and wants a loan to add capital. Catherine B. operates a business of used clothing sales and wants to build a clothes shop.

loans.use: To add more capital to rice business and expand it

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Mr. K. Hong and his wife, Ngau Sokheng, have been married since 1984. They have three children; two sons and one daughter. One of their children is a construction worker and other two are students at the local school. Mr. Hong has been a taxi driver for two years and a farmer while his wife has grown flowers for resale since 1985.

Mr. Hong and his family live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong and approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Both husband and wife hope that their business will support the family and allow their children to continue their education.

Mr. Hong is requesting his first loan in the amount of $300. He will use this money to purchase flower beds for his wife to increase her flower sales.

loans.use: To purchase additional flower beds for resale

loans.name: Busiya East H Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Justine N.. She is currently in the business of pig rearing and is requesting a loan to purchase pig feed and more piglets. Justine is 38 years old and married, with five children who go to school. Each week, Justine makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest into her business. Justine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Justine is joined in her small group by Norah W. and Lilian N.. Norah W. has a business in sugarcane growing and wants to buy more land to expand the business. Lilian N. is currently operating a drug shop business and wants a loan to purchase more drugs to sell.

loans.use: To add to piggery business

loans.name: Kani East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Saida N.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell. Saida is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 5 children ranging from age 5 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Saida makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and invest more in her business. Saida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Saida is joined in her small group by Zaituni N. and Esther M.. Zaituni N. has a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more bags of charcoal to increase stock. Esther M. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to add more working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru:
Nazar S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 40 years old, a widower, and has 2 children. He has a specialized High School education - he is a trained construction worker. He works at a construction site, but in addition to that resells cattle. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. He purchase calves in his own village and sells them on the market for the the Rudaki region. This system of purchase and resale allows the inhabitants of the Rudaki region to purchase animals without spending money on travel. This business also allows to improve the financial situation of the S. family. Nazar plans to repay the loan in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Житель района Рудаки.Вдовец имеет 2 детей.Возраст 40 лет. Образование средне-специальное. По специальности строитель. Зарабатывает работая на стройке.Кроме того занимается купле-продажей Крупно рогатого скота.Занимается этим бизнесом уже 5 лет.Скупает бычков в собственном кишлаке и реализует на рынке района Рудаки. Эта система скупки позволяет населению кишлака не тратиться на транспорт.Кроме того занятие торговлей КРС позволяет улучшить финансовое положение в семье.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Nhom Chi Vui - Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Vui has 3 children. She raises pigs at home and sells waste metal. her husband is a construction worker. Their family income is 3.75 - 6.25 USD a day. She will use the loan to buy pig mash.
Mrs Giá will use the loan to buy chicken feed and pig mash.
Mrs Duyên will use the loan to buy grocery to resell .
Mrs Xuân will use the loan to buy breeding pigs.
Mrs Bình will use the loan to buy chicken feed and pig mash .
Mrs Tám will use the loan to breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunterr.

Chị Vui có ba con đang đi học và đi làm. Chị làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt. Chồng chị làm thợ xây. Thu nhập trung bình khoảng 80000 - 100000 đồng/ngày. Chị vay vốn để mua cám cho lợn.
Chị Giá vay vốn để mua cám cho lợn, gà.
Chị Duyên vay vốn để đi chợ sắt.
Chị Xuân vay để mua lợn giống.
Chị Bình vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà.
Cô Tám vay để mua giống lợn.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed, pig mash, breeding pigs, grocery

loans.name: Kyerinda East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Francis Kabangonza. She is currently in the business of running a beauty parlor and is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics. Francis is 43 years old and is married. Her husband is a banker. She has 4 children ranging from age 13 to 25 and only three go to school. Each week, Francis makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business. Francis has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Francis is joined in her small group by Jennifer M., Aisha B., Alice M., and Cathy N.. Jennifer M. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to boost business. Aisha B. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to add more items. Alice M. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more stock. Cathy N. is currently in the business of selling chicken and is requesting a loan to buy more chicken to sell.

loans.use: To expand beauty parlor business

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Nigina Kurbonova S. lives in the city of Yavan. She is married and has 4 children. She has a High School education. She sells cottonseed oil. She has 10 years experience working in this business. She purchase cottonseed oil at the cotton factory at a wholesale price and resells it on the market in Yavan as well as from home at a higher retail price. She plans to use the obtained credit to increase turnover. Increasing turnover will allow her to increase the profit obtained from the business. Cottonseed oil is in high demand in rural areas, therefore Nigina's business helps the local population purchase this good at an affordable price. Because the seller purchases the good in the same city and does not need to spend additional money on delivering it to the market, the price remains much lower than if it was delivered from the capital. Nigina plans to repay the loan in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Шодиева Нигина Курбоновна жительница города Яван.Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее.Занимается торговлей хлопкового масла. Опыт работы в данной деятельности уже 10 лет. Покупает масло на Хлопковом заводе по более низкой цене и реализует на рынке Явана, а так же из дома. Планируемый кредит хочет использовать на увеличение товарооборота. Если она увеличит оборотную сумму объем ее реализаций увеличится и соответственно увеличится ее доход.В сельской местности большим спросом пользуется данная продукция, поэтому занимаясь этим клиентка дает возможность населению проибретать масло по доступным ценам, т.к продавец не расходует деньги на поставку товара, а приобретает в том же городе, соответственно в наценке не учитывается расход на транспорт и цена становится ниже, чем если бы масло привозили из столицы. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher lives with his wife and three children in Saida, in south Lebanon. Maher is a 36-year-old carpenter who also works as a fisherman. This is the fourth time Maher has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua, and he intends to use this new loan to buy supplies for his carpentry work and repair his fishing boat. He will use the revenues generated by the loan to pay for his children's tuition.

loans.use: To buy material for a carpentry shop and to repair a fishing boat

loans.name: Kyerinda East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth K.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feeds and bring more chicks. Ruth is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a veterinary assistant. She has 6 children and her children go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add in business Ruth has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Safina B., Jesca W. and Suzan N.. Safina B. has a business in beauty parlor and wants to buy more cosmetics, oils and lotions. Jesca W. is currently operating a business in coffee selling and wants a loan to increase capital. Suzan N. operates a business of beauty parlor and wants to boost business by purchasing a variety of cosmetics.

loans.use: To boost poultry business

loans.name: Saad

texts.en: Saad is 55 years old and lives in south Lebanon, in the town of Saida. Saad is in the wood-carving business. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua, and he will use this latest loan to buy supplies for his workshop and enhanced his productivity.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a wood-carving business

loans.name: Husnigul

texts.ru:
Husnigul Hafizovna S. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a High School education. She is a housewife. She is in the business of raising cattle. She has more than 10 years experience working in this business. She purchase young calves, raises them for 40 to 45 days and resells them at the market. She plans to use the loan to increase turnover. She wants to purchase 2 additional calves. The profit from this business allows to Husnigul to take care of her family. The business also provides the local community with healthy cattle that is used for meat. She plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Саиджонова Хуснигуль Хафизовна проживает в городе Яван. Замужем имеет 4 детей. Возраст 48 лет. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Занимается разведением и торговлей крупно рогатого скота.Опыт в данном бизнесе около 10 лет. Покупает бычков , откармливает 40-45 дней и продает на рынке.Кредит планирует использовать на увеличение товарооборота то есть хочет приобрести еще двоих бычков . Этот бизнес дает доход который дает возможность обеспечивать свою семью, а так же обеспечить рынки здоровым скотом, который используют на мясо. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan lives with his wife and their child in Saida, in south Lebanon. Hassan is 29 years old and runs a small wood-carving business. This is the second time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua, and he intends to use this new loan to buy materials that will allow him to increase the productivity of his workshop.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a wood-carving business

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru:
Gulandom M. lives in the Yavan region. She is 28 years old, single and does not have children. She has a High School education. She is in the business of selling clothing. She has her own sales location on the market. She brings clothing for sale from the the city of Dushanbe and sells it in Yavan. Because she does not yet have her own family, she helps her parents. She has 12 years experience working in this business. She plans to use the obtained loan to purchase spring clothing for sale. Her business makes it possible for the locals to purchase the necessary articles of clothing locally and at an affordable price without having to spend a lot of money on the road. She plans to repay the loan in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazu, Kiva volunteer

Музафарова Гуландом жительница Яванского района. Возраст 28 лет , не замужем, детей не имеет.Образование среднее. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли одеждой. Имеет торговую точку на рынке в районе. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и реализует в Яване.Т.к своей семьи не имеет помогает родителям. Опыт в этом бизнесе 12 лет.Кредит планирует использовать для ввоза весеннего товара.Так же ее бизнес дает возможность населению покупать необходимые вещи у себя в районе по доступным ценам не затрачивая деньги на дорогу. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase spring clothing

loans.name: Kyerinda East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah M.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy more chicks. Sarah is 25 years old and is married to her husband, who is a mechanic for work. She has 3 children, all of whom go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and boost her business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Suzan N., Rose Kalembe, Aliziki N., and Magret B.. Suzan N. has a business rearing cows and wants to buy insecticides and cow feed. Rose Kalembe is currently operating a business in poultry farming and wants a loan to purchase chicken mash (feed). Aliziki N. operates a retail shop business and wants to increase stock. Magret B. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase a fridge and uplift business.

loans.use: To expand poultry business and make more profits

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: Mustapha is a 39 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Saida, in south Lebanon. Mustapha owns a coffee shop, and needs a loan to redecorate his business and buy chairs, tables and hubble bubbles or water pipes. Mustapha is excited at the prospects of being able to improve his coffee shop in this way.

loans.use: To redecorate a small coffee shop

loans.name: Thi Hue

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hue, 20 years old, has 1 child. Her husband is a builder. Her family current income is 3.2-4.4 USD/ day. Besides doing agricultural activities like many other families, her family also sells rice in the market. Because the Binh Minh CDC Microeconomic Program has weekly repaying policy, which is very advantageous for her family, she decided to borrow 150 USD to buy one more rice-husking machine to increase productivity.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Huế, 20 tuổi, có một con nhỏ. Chồng chị là thợ xây ở làng. Thu nhập của gia đình chị chỉ từ 50000-70000đồng/ngày. Ngoài công việc nhà nông như bao gia đình khác, gia đình chị còn đi chợ bán hàng gạo. Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc có hình thức trả góp theo tuần rất hay và thuận tiện cho công việc làm ăn của gia đình chị, vì vậy, chị đã vay 2006000đồng để mua thêm một máy xay xát gạo, tăng năng suất lao động.

loans.use: buy rice-husking machine

loans.name: Fathi

texts.en: Fathi lives with his wife and six children in the southern Lebanese town of Saida. Fathi is 47 years old and runs a small wood-carving business. This is the fifth time Fathi has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua, and he plans to use this new loan to improve the productivity of his shop.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a small wood-carving business

loans.name: Kyerinda East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose K.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to construct another poultry house and bring more birds. Rose is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 5 children, all of whom go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 13000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in the business. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Mirabu B., Alice K., Prossy K., and Teopista K.. Mirabu B. has a business in pig rearing and wants to expand the business to buy more piglets. Alice K. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase more shop items. Prossy K. operates a business selling rice and wants to stock more sacks of rice. Teopista K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling.

loans.use: To boost poultry business

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad lives with his wife and three children in south Lebanon, in the town of Saida. He is a 38 years old and paints furniture for a living. This is the second time Imad has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He plans to use this new loan to buy supplies for his workshop.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a furniture-painting business

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru:
Hafiza Shodievna P. lives in the Hurson region. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a High School education and is currently unemployed. She takes care of her big family and works in the filed. The family owns a piece of land on which they sow wheat. When the wheat is ready they sell it on the market, keeping enough to provide for the family for the entire year. This business helps take care of the family financially. In addition to that wheat, is a good that is always in demand in Tajikistan, so Hafiza's business helps provide the population with flower. She plans to repay the loan in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Пирова Хафиза Шодиевна проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 47 лет , замужем имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее.Нигде не работает. Домохозяйка ,занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли .засеивает пшеницей , а затем собрвав урожай реализует на рынке , а так же оставляет запас зерна своей семье на весь год.Этот бизнес помогает поддерживать финансовую сторону семьи.Кроме того спрос на пшеницу всегда имеет спрос на рынках Таджикистана , поэтому и ее бизнес помогает обеспечить население мукой.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует за 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Alikhan

texts.en: Alikhan M. is a 33-year-old trader who has a small food store in the small village of Saatli. He has seven years of experience in this field. He applied for $1200 USD to expand his business and diversify the products he sells.

loans.use: To diversify the products in his food store

loans.name: Kyerinda East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Florence N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Florence is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist for work. She has 4 children all of whom go to school. Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand business Florence has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Florence is joined in her small group by Cathy N., Mariam M., Christine M., and Jennifer T.. Cathy N. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to boost business. Mariam M. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to add capital. Christine M. operates a grocery shop business and wants to purchase more groceries. Jennifer T. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To increase stock in retail shop

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en: Yehia is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the town of Saida in southern Lebanon. Yehia is in the aluminum business, and this is the second time he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He needs to buy supplies for his company, and will use the increased income made possible by the loan to help pay his family's living expenses.

loans.use: To buy supplies for an aluminum business

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan M. is a 33-year-old trader who sells food, cosmetics, perfume and other goods in his small store in a small village in the Saatli region. He has five years of experience in this field. The income he has is just enough to cover his family's needs but his wish is to expand the number of products he sells, because demand for perfume and cosmetics is very high. For this purpose he applied for a loan of $1100.

loans.use: To expand number of products

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is 26 years old and lives in the town of Saida in south Lebanon. He owns a restaurant, and this is the second time he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He plans to use this new loan to expand his business. Maher is also planning to buy a car and the revenue generated by this loan will help him pay for it.

loans.use: To expand and upgrade a restaurant

loans.name: Kyerinda East F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sepiranza B.. She is currently in the business of retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Sepiranza is 23 years old and is divorced. Each week, Sepiranza makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in business

Sepiranza is joined in her small group by Violah L., Sophie L. and Suzan M.. Violah L. has a business in fish selling and wants to add in more capital. Sophie L. is currently operating a business in milk selling and wants a loan to add in business. Suzan M. operates a business of coffee selling and wants to expand business.

loans.use: To expand retail shop business

loans.name: Mahmadradjab

texts.ru:
Mahmadradjab H. lives in the Djomi region. He is 22 years old, single and does not have children. He has a High School education. He works in a cotton factory in the village of Ujala. He is also a farmer. He sows wheat. He plans to use the money from the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to be able to plant wheat on his land. When the wheat will be ready he plans to sell most of it on the market at an affordable price, while keeping the rest for his own family. This will allow him not to have to worry about purchasing flower for an entire year. He plans to repay the credit in a 10 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Худойназаров Махмадраджаб житель района Джоми. Возраст 22 года ,холост ,детей не имеет.Образование среднее. Работает на хлопзаводе в кишлаке Уяла.Кроме того занимается земледелием.То есть посевом пшеницы. Кредит хочет использовать на покупку удобрений и зерна для засева земельного участка. После получения урожая клиент продает пшеницу на рынке населению по доступным ценам , а так же часть пшеницы оставляет своей семье, что помогает весь год не думать о муке.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman M. is a 34-year-old farmer who raises livestock for meat production. He lives in the Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) settlement in the Bilasuvar region. He is married and has three children. Demand for meat is very high all across Azerbaijan, and this business is very profitable. Beside this, Salman's family is very poor and needs more funds to improve their life conditions. That’s why Salman decided to purchase an additional three calves, for $300 each, and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Hồng - Cụm Vọng Nguyệt Xã Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Hồng, group leader, is 31 years old. She has 3 children who are still in school.She supplies construction material to local consumers. Her husband is a truck driver. Her family income is 6.25 USD a day. She request this loan to buy bricks.
Mrs Bảo will use the loan to buy pork.
Mrs Loan will use the loan to buy pig mash.
Mrs Oanh will use the loan to stock her grocery store.
Mrs Tiền will use the loan to buy waste metal to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunterr.

Chị Hồng 31 tuổi, có 3 con đang đi học. Chị làm nghề chở vật liệu xây dựng cho các gia đình trong địa phương. Chồng chị lái xe chở vật liệu. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị khoảng 100000 đồng/ngày. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm gạch.
Chị Bảo vay vốn để thêm vốn bán thực phẩm (thịt lợn).
Chị Loan vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn.
Chị Oanh vay vốn để bán hàng tạp hoá.
Cô Tiền vay để đi chợ sắt.

loans.use: to buy bricks, pork, pig mash, grocery, waste metal

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru:
Daler Olimovich H., 32, lives in Fayzabad district. He is married with two children. Daler has a higher education; he was trained as a livestock expert. His current business involves buying cattle at the market, fattening them over 40-45 days and re-selling them to butchers at the same market. This supplies the local market with meat at accessible prices. In addition, this business allows Daler to support his family. He has been in business for four years. He plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Хушмахмадов Далер Олимович проживает в районе Файзабад.Возраст32 года, женат имеет двоих детей. Образование высшее. По специальности зоотехник. Занимается торговлей Крупно- рогатого скота. приобретает бычков клиент на рынке , а после откормки через 40-45 дней реализует на тех же рынках. В основном его бычков скупают мясники , которые используют бычков на мясо. Это позволяет обеспечить рынки мясом по доступным ценам. Кроме того этот бизнес позволяет обеспечивать свою семью. Занимается данной деятельностью клиент уже 4 года.. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Heydar

texts.en: Heydar R. is a 53-year-old farmer who runs his dairy business in a small village in Saatli. He is married and has four children. Heydar has more than ten years of experience in this field. He is going to expand his business and purchase an additional milker cow for $700 and two baby calves for an estimated cost of $200 each.

loans.use: To purchase milker cow and two baby calves

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: Jalal S. is a 50-year-old farmer who breeds cattle in a small village in the Saatli region. He has seven years of experience in this field. He runs this business because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. Generally Jalal purchases baby calves, raises them and then sells them to the local bazaar traders. Jalal has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase four calves at an estimated cost of $300 each.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Salminaz

texts.en: Salminaz T. is a 44-year-old woman who sells calves for meat production. She has six years of experience in this field. She lives with her husband and three children in a small village in the Saatli region. As Salminaz and her husband are unemployed, selling calves to the local bazaar traders for meat is the only financial source for such a big family. She decided to purchase additional calves to improve the conditions of her family. For this purpose she applied for a loan of $1100 to purchase three calves for $300 each and fodder for $200.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru:
Rajabgul S., 42, lives in Fayzabad district. She is a married mother of eight. Rajabgul has a secondary school education and does not work outside the home. However, she has been in business raising cows for sale and for their milk for five years. Rajabgul is applying for a loan to buy a milk cow. She will sell the milk to wholesalers, earning a good profit. This will allow her to make payments on the loan, and the cow will remain hers when all has been repaid. Rajabgul plans to repay her loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Сайфуддинова Раджабгуль проживает в районе Файзабад.Возраст 42 года Замужем имеет 8 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка, но занимается животноводством. Разводит коров на продажу и для продажи молока. Занимается этим бизнесом клиентка уже 5 лет. На планируемый кредит хочет купитьдойную корову которая будет довать молоко.Молоко будет продаваться оптовым покупателям, что будет давать неплохой доход . Это позволит погашать кредит, а корова останется в прибыль хозяевам. Погашать кредит клиентка планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail M. is a 51-year-old trader who keeps a small store where he sells men's clothes, shells and other items. He is married and has four children. Ismail is a repeat borrower from Aqroinvest; he borrowed two loans and successfully repaid them on time. Now Ismail is going to expand his business and diversify the number of products.

loans.use: To expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hamidamo

texts.ru:
Hamidamo I., 39, lives in Vakhsh district. She has a secondary school education. She is married with three children and does not work outside the home. She has one cow and is applying for a loan to buy another one; she'll use the milk both for her own family and to sell. This will allow Hamidamo to improve her family's financial position. Profits from the milk she sells will go towards repaying her loan, and when the full amount is repaid, the cow will remain in her posession. She has been raising and caring for livestock for three years. She plans to repay her loan within one year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Исматова Хамидамо жительница района Вахш. Возраст 39 лет. Замужем имеет3 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка,занимается животноводством.имеет корову , но планирует получить кредит , чтобы купить еще одну для того чтобы получать молоко для своей семьи , а так же на продажу. Это дает возможность улучшить финансовое положение семьи, т. к прибыль от продаваемого молока клиентка сможет использоват на погашение кредита , а в конце срока корова останется ей. Занимается клиентка животноводством уже 3 года. Погасить кредитклиент планирует в течении12 месяцев

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Joka

texts.en: Joka was born in 1941 and lives in the village of Laktaši with her husband, who is retired. His pension is 150 KM per month. They receive aid from abroad that amounts to an additional 500 KM per month. She intends to use this loan for 1,000 KM to buy livestock. Working with her husband, she will produce milk products and reduce their need to buy them somewhere else.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a 40-year-old father of 3, and a resident of Tandika. He has various businesses including sales of radios, TVs, and other electronics. He also owns a shop selling traditional medicine in the Tandika area, which his wife is taking care of. He gets the medicine from traditional healers, and he gets prescriptions from Zanzibar and Tabora. He is in need of USD $600 to help him expand his business.

loans.use: Expand his business of natural medicines

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru:
Rahmatullo Rakhmonovich M., 48, lives in Jomi district. He is married and has one child. Rahmatullo has a specialized secondary school education; he was trained as a mechanic. However, he doesn't work in this job, instead buying and selling livestock as a business in Jomi. He buys calves at the market, fattens them over 40-45 days and then sells them back at the same market to local butchers. This business is his family's main source of income and also allows local residents to buy fresh meat at accessible prices. Rahmatullo plans to repay his loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Меликов Рахматулло Рахмонович проживает в районе Джоми. Возраст 48 лет. Женат имеет 1 ребенка.
