Образование средне-специальное, по специальности механик.По специальности не работает ,но занимается торговлей крупно рогатого скота.Место бизнеса район Джоми. Приобретает бычков на рынке,а через 40-45 дней после откормки продает на тех же рынках. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, что позволяет ее обеспечивать.Кроме того после того как он их откармливает клиент продает бычков мясникам, которые используют их на мясо.Поэтому этот бизнес помогает населению приобретать свежее мясо по доступным ценам.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is 56 years old and a resident of the Tandika area in Dar Es Salaam city. She runs a small restaurant at her home, a business which she has had for the past ten years. She is in need of a loan to to help her expand her business

loans.use: Expand her cafe business

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru:
Rahim Dzhuraboyevich M., 49, lives in Jomi district. He has a secondary school education and is married with seven children. He is an enterpreneur specializing in livestock. He buys calves cheaply and sells them back at the same markets for higher prices one week later. Trading in livestock allows Rahim to support his family; this business is their only source of income. This activity also supplies the local markets with meat at accessible prices. Rahim has been raising and selling livestock for 15 years. He plans to repay his loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Махмаджанов Рахим Джурабоевич житель района Джоми. Возраст 49 лет. Женат имеет семерых детей. Образование среднее. Занимается предпринимательством в сфере животноводства. Закупает бычков подешевле,через неделю перепродает на тех же рынках.Торговля крупно рогатым скотом позволяет клиенту обеспечивать свою семью, т.к этот бизнес является единственным источником его дохода.Так же торговля КРС позволяет обепечивать рынки мясом по доступным ценам. Занимается клиент этим бизнесом уже 15 лет. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia is a mother of three children, and a resident of the Makangarawe area in Dar Es Salaam city. She has a charcoal store at her home. She orders the charcoal from the neighboring regions of Pwani and Morogoro. Her business sometimes is affected by the rainy season and sometimes the forestry authority limit their activities, as overdeforestation is illegal. She is in need of more money to help her expand the business.

loans.use: Expand her retail business

loans.name: Tanti Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Tanti Elisabeth was born on August 18, 1959 in Lomé and lives in the Adobou-Komé district. Born handicapped, she takes care of four children and is a widow. Her work is centered around the manufacture and sale of dolls to tourists at the large market in Lomé. She also sells various other products at the market. Due to a lack of funds, she is requesting through this project a credit of $500 in order to increase her production capacity and to satisfy her customers' needs. Through her devotion, she shows a good sense of managing her business which will enable her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Madame A. Tanti Elisabeth est née le 18 Août 1959 à Lomé et domiciliée au quartier Adobou-Komé. Née handicapée, elle a à sa charge quatre enfants et restée veuve. Ses activités sont axées sur la confection et la vente des poupées aux touristes au grand marché de Lomé, elle a également associe à son travail la vente des produits divers. Manque de fonds, elle sollicite à travers ce projet un crédit de $500 en vue d’augmenter sa capacité de production en poupées et satisfaire sa clientèle. Par son dévouement, elle fait preuve d’une bonne gestion de ses activités ce qui lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and wire for the manufacture of dolls

loans.name: Aubhon

texts.ru:
Aubhon B., 40, lives in Jomi district. He is married with four children and has a high school education. He works on the Aral collective farm. He has also been involved in private agricultural activities for about ten years. He rents some land where he plans wheat and other crops, such as flax. After the harvest, Aubhon sells a portion of the wheat and flax oil produced for cash. His family's portion supplies them with flour and oil for the next year. By developing rural agriculture, Aubhon provides the local market with wheat and oil at accesible prices. He plans to repay his loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Бобохонов Аюбхон житель района Джоми. Женат имеет четверых детей. Возраст 40 лет. Образование среднее. Специальности не имеет работает в колхозе Арал в дехканском хозяйстве. В частном порядке занимается земледелием около 10 лет. Имеет арендованную землю которую засеивает пшеницей и другими зерновыми, такие как лен.Этот бизнес помогает клиенту обеспечивать свою семью мукой, маслом и деньгами,т.к. после получения урожая клиент продает часть пшеницы и часть масла переработанного из льна. Часть той же продукции оставляет семье запсом на 1 год.Развивая сельское хозяйство клиент обеспечивает рынок данной продукцией по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Thư - Cụm Vọng Nguyệt - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thư 33 years old, has two children who are still going to school. She is breeding pigs. Besides that, she and her husband also work on the rice field, and make wine. Her family income is 4.5-5 USD/day. Other members of the group also have different ideas to use the borrowed money.
Mrs. Huệ buys chicken-feed and veterinary medicines for her chickens.
Mrs. Đảmbuys more merchandise for her general store.
Mrs. Giao buys more pigs.
Mrs. Hà buys chicken-feed for her chickens.
Mrs.Giang buys wasted-metal material and also makes tofu to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thư, 33 tuổi có 2 con đang đi học. Chị nuôi rất nhiều lợn thịt. Chị mua cám cho lợn ăn, N.ài chăn nuôi lợn, vợ chồng chị còn làm ruộng, nấu rượu. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị khoảng 70 - 80 000 đồng/ngày. Các thành viên còn lại trong nhóm có mục đích sử dụng vốn rất đa dạng.
Chị Huệ thêm vốn mua cám, thuốc thu y cho gà đẻ của gia đình.
Chị Đảm thêm vốn mua hàng tạp hoá bán tại nhà.
Chị Giao thêm vốn mua lợn giống.
Chị Hà vay vốn để mua cám cho đàn gà đẻ.
Chị Giang vay vốn để đi chợ sắt vụn và làm đậu phụ bán.

loans.use: to buy pig mash, chicken-feed, veterinary medicine, merchandise for general store

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio G. Ortega is 46 years old and married to Luisa Diaz. He is a father of four and the owner a local vehicle repair shop. He has been in business now for 28 years and has built a great reputation throughout the town for his business and his personality.

Antonio works hard to provide his family with the best quality of life he can. With a dedicated clientele, he works daily to fix anything from cars to trucks and motorcycles. He is asking for a loan to buy more spare parts for his business and to support the maintenance of the shop.

loans.use: To expand a vehicle repair business

loans.name: Adjo Odette

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Adjo Odette was born in Lome on April 17, 1963 and lives in the Adobou-Komé district. Born handicapped, she is unmarried and takes care of two people. She makes and sells dolls to tourists in the large market of Lomé. In addition, she sells ice water and "pure water". Due to a lack of funds, she is requesting a loan of $300 in order to increase her production and satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Madame A. Adjo Odette est née à Lomé le 17 Avril 1963 et réside au quartier Adobou-Komé. Née handicapée, elle est célibataire et a à sa charge 2 personnes. Ses activités sont axées sur la confection et la vente des poupées aux touristes au grand marché de Lomé. En plus elle associe à cette tâche la vente d’eau glacée et de « pure water », Par manque de fonds, elle sollicite un prêt de $300 en vue d’augmenter sa production afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to manufacture dolls

loans.name: Mirzoboev

texts.ru:
M. Mirzoboev is 48 years old, married and has 6 children. His main source of income comes from fattening and sale of livestock, mainly sheep. Currently he has 5 rams in his barn. After feeding the animals for one month he immediately sells them at the Chairuch market and buys cheaper ones. His wife spins yarn from the sheep's wool, providing additional income for the family. Currently the market price for livestock are low and Mr. Mirzoboev is planning to purchase a few young rams, which is why he has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Махмудчон Мирзобоев 48 лет, отец 6 детей, основной доход имеет от откорма и продажи скота.Во сновном он покупает мелкорогатый скот.Сейчас имеет 5 баранов.Откормив один месяц он сразу продает на Чайрухском базаре и покупает подешевле.Его жена прядет прядь из бараньей шерсти.Счего она имеет семейный доход.Поэтому пока сезон дешевого скота он хочет закупить еще несколько маленьких барашек.Для чего и хочет получить займ

loans.use: Raising and sale of sheep

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca M. Gonzalez is a 38-year-old mother of two who lives with her husband in the city of San Estanislao. Her husband works on cars in a service station and Francisca runs a small convenience store from her house. For six years now she has worked in this business and wants to increase its size and the variety of merchandise.

Francisca plans to continue expanding and, when enough money is saved, she will open a small area in her shop to sell ice cream. There is great traffic near the store as it is, but with ice cream for sale, she will attract the children of the nearby school as well. With the loan, Francisca will purchase more merchandise and a wider variety of goods for her convenience store.

loans.use: To expand a convenience store

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.ru:
Ubaydullo Turdialievich H. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 23 and married with two children. Ubaydullo has a secondary school education and works as a mechanic. He owns a car wash in his city and has been in business for three years. This business helps support his family as well as providing local residents with access to car wash services. Ubaydullo is applying for a loan in order to get new car wash equipment in order to improve the services he offers. This will help him attract more customers and earn more money. He plans to repay the loan within five months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Хакимов Убайдулло Турдиалиевич житель города Курган-тюбе. Возраст 23 года, женат имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее ,работает автослесарем .Имеет автомойку в городе Курган-тюбе.. Данным видом деятельности клиент занимается уже 3 года.Его бизнес помогает обеспечивать свою семью, а также помогает населению получить доступ к данным услугам. Планирует получить кредит для приобретения оборудования, для мойки . чтобы улучшить сервис обслуживания. Это поможет увеличить количество клиентов , что даст возможность увеличить заработок..Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 5 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying car wash equipment

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr:
34 years old, Miss W. Odette is unmarried and a mother of one child. She also takes care of two other people. Abandoned by her husband, she works as a seamstress which has helped her obtain her diploma; however, she still lives in deplorable conditions. Through this marvelous project, Odette is asking for a financing of $1000 in order to buy a sewing machine, thread and other sewing supplies. She would also like to buy a motor bike so that she can work as a taxi driver in order to provide for the needs of her family. This will also enable her to undoubtedly grow her business and thus increase her income so that she can improve the economic and social living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Agée de 34 ans, Mademoiselle W. Odette est célibataire avec un (1) enfant et deux autre personne à sa charge. Abandonnée par son mari, elle s’est lancée dans la couture ce qui lui permettra d’avoir son diplôme et ceci dans une condition déplorable. Par ce merveilleux projet, Odette demande un financement de $1000 pour l’acquisition d’une machine à coudre, d’une machine à surfiler et d’autres fournitures de couture et s’acheter une moto pour faire taxi moto afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Ceci lui permettra également d’augmenter à coup sûr ses affaires et de facto ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie économique et sociale de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru:
Shamsiddin Gulmorodov lives in the Khuroson region. He is 42 years old and is married with 7 children. He has a secondary education. He is a farmer. He plants wheat and other grain. During summer, he harvests his crops and the sells it at the local market. He is applying for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Farming allows Shamsiddin to provide for his family as well as supply the local market with grain and flour. Shamsiddin is planning to repay his loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Гулмуродов Шамсиддин житель района Хуросон. Возраст 42 года женат, имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее, специальности не имеет. Занимается сельским хозяйством.Засеивает пшеницу и другие зерновые культуры.А летом собрав урожай продает на рынке зерно пшеницы.Кредит запрашивает на покупку семян и удобрений.Этот вид деятельности позволяет кормить семью клиента , а также позволяет обеспечить рынки пшеницей и мукой.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Tp purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru:
Murod H. lives in Rudaki. He is married with four children. Murod is 36 years old and has a secondary education. He makes a living buying and selling cattle. He buys cattle from his neighbors in his village and sells them at a regional market. This business gives him a source to make money since he can sell cattle at a higher price at the market, while his neighbors are saving money on their transportation expenses. Murod is applying for a loan because he wants to increase his turnover. He is planning to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хабибов Мурод житель района Рудаки.Женат имеет 4 детей. Возраст 36 лет. Образование среднее.Зарабатывает на жизнь путем куплепродажи крупно рогатого скота.Скупает животных у соседей в своем кишлаке . а потом продает на рынке в районе.Этот бизнес дает возможность населению сэкономить деньги соседям ,т.к. они не тратят деньги на дорогу до рынка . чтобы продать бычка или корову,а так же клиенту покупая бычка у соседей он может продать товар подороже на рынке. Это даст возможность неплохо заработать. Хочет получить кредит , чтобы увеличить оборотную сумму.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Djumankulov

texts.ru:
A. Djumankulov is 55 years old, married and has 6 children. Since his childhood he has been raising and fattening cattle for sale. He is also a skilled veterinary. Currently he has two cows with calves in his barn. His wife milks the cows and sells the milk at the market. After the calves are full grown, A. sells the cows and buys new animals, while leaving the calves for fattening. He is planning to buy two additional cows and has turned to Microinvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Чуманкулов Абдухамит,возрост 55 лет имеет,6 детей.Сдетства он занимается откормом и уходом за скотом.Он сам также хороший ветеринар.Сейчас имеет дома две коровы с телятами.Его жена доит молоко и продает на базаре.Откормив теленка Абдухамит продает коровы и взамен покупает новые, а телята остаются до готовновти.Поэтому он хочет,купить еще две большие коровы.Для чего обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Fattening and sale of cattle

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio Alcides O. is a thirty-nine-year-old single man who runs an advertising business that includes designs and printing. He has been working in this area for 10 years and he has earned a great reputation throughout the city.

With the loan, Lucio would like to buy a screen-printing machine. This will allow him to place his designs on T-shirts and sell clothing. The new line of business will expand his business and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy printing materials and a screen printing machine

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba sells wood and construction materials, like cement, in the Tandika market. She sells it mainly to carpenters and those in the construction business. She orders her wood from the southern highlands of Tanzania. She is in need of  a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her construction business

loans.name: Komlan Faustin

texts.fr:
Mr. A. Komlan Faustin was born on May 21, 1963 in Lome. He is handicapped, a father of one child and takes care of another person. Due to a lack of means, he had to give up his training in computer science and became a shoemaker. Having received his diploma after his training, he is now asking for a loan in order to open a workshop and to buy supplies and materials so that he can showcase his knowledge to his customers. A well-organized man, he would like to establish a more consistent credit in order to build other commercial activities. His dynamism and skill are his best assets to ensure the success of this project.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva translator

Monsieur A. Komlan Faustin est né le 21 Mai 1963 à Lomé père d'un (1) enfant et a une personne en charge et handicapé. Par manque de moyen, il abandonne sa formation en informatique et apprend la cordonnerie. Ayant reçu son diplôme après sa formation, il sollicite un crédit afin d'ouvrir un atelier et acquérir des fournitures et matériels de cordonnerie pour faire ressortir son savoir faire à sa clientèle. Bien organisé, il pense avoir plus tard un crédit plus consistant pour associer à la cordonnerie d'autres initiatives du genre commercial. Son dynamisme et son habileté constituent autant d'atouts pour le succès de son projet.

loans.use: Opening a shoemaking workshop and purchase of materials

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia L. de Mendez is a busy mother of six children. She is married and owns her own house and business. For eight years she has been running her own grocery store and she has gained a dedicated clientele and has excellent business references.

Mauricia is asking for a loan in order to increase her store's merchandise, including milk, sugar, corn, pasta, bread, rice, vegetables, and fruit. With more merchandise she will be able to increase business and better the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To expand the stock of a grocery store

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili runs a ladies beauty salon in the Tandika area of Dar Es Salaam city suburb. She has recently expanded her salon and can now accommodate five clients at a time. She employs three people. Pili is in need of a loan  to help her buy another dryer, and stock cosmetics for her businesses.

loans.use: Expand her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase material and sewing accessories for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 32-year-old mother of 3, and a resident of Tandika. She sells wood and carpentry materials for construction purposes. She orders it from the Morogoro region and the Rufigi area. Recently, the forest authority has restricted deforestation, and this has affected her business. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: Expand her construction business

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque Ramon R. is married to his wife Nilda and together they have four children. He owns a convenience store and butcher shop. Roque has a piece of property where he grows a small amount of food plants and also raises animals. At the moment he can only afford to slaughter one animal per week.

With a loan, Roque will invest money in another piece of property where he will be able to raise more animals and increase his meat sales, thereby bettering the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to invest into another piece of property

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Alisher S. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 25 years old and is unmarried. He has a secondary education. He raises cattle. He has been in this business for 3 years. He is planning to buy a cow using the proceeds of his loan. This will increase the size of his herd. After he increases the size of his herd, he plans on selling the older cows and raising the younger ones. After the cow gives birth he can sell the milk, which becomes an additional source of income for him. This business gives him a chance to provide for his family as well as supply the local market with fresh milk and meat. He is planning to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Саидов Алишер Ашурович проживает в районе Файзабад. Возраст 25 лет, холост детей не имеет. Образование среднее. Занимается разведением КРС. Занимается данным бизнесом клиент уже 3 года. На планируемый кредит хочет купить корову для того чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. После того как количество поголовья увеличится клиент продает старых и растит молодняк. Кроме того отелившаяся корова дает молоко которое продается и дает дополнительный доход хозяевам.Этот бизнес дает возможность обеспечивать семью клиента а также обеспечивать рынки свежим молоком и мясом. Погашать кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Daima

texts.en: Daima is a hard-working mother of 3, and a resident of Tandika, Dar Es Salaam city suburb. She has been in business for the five years, and runs a shop selling food, ranging from beans, maize, rice, and other items. She is in need of USD $1200 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Kyerinda East G Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Moreen K.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Moreen is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 2 children aged 18 and 20 and her children both go to school. Each week, Moreen makes approximately UGX 6500 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to improve business. Moreen has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Moreen is joined in her small group by Veronica I., Sarah N. and Mavin M.. Veronica I. has a business operating a hardware shop and wants to increase stock. Sarah N. is currently operating a business selling spare parts and wants a loan to add more capital. Mavin M. operates a farming business and wants to purchase more farm supplies.

loans.use: To expand and boost poultry business

loans.name: Yimi

texts.en:
Yimi M. Riveros is a father of two children. His business is preparing sausages. He works with all different types of meats and specializes in putting the casing on the sausages. Yimi also has two motorcycles and car that he uses to deliver his products. For three years he has run his business with his father and brother. Yimi is also a part-time student and attends night school twice a week.

Yimi will use his loan to invest in a truck to transport his merchandise, thereby expanding his business and income.

loans.use: To invest in a truck

loans.name: Kirangira East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah K.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Sarah is 47 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 8 children ranging from age 9 to 25 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 18000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business and educate her children. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Joy K., Rashida K., Faith M., and Suzan N.. Joy K. has a business rearing chickens and cows and wants to purchase more chicks and feed. Rashida K. is currently operating a cow rearing business and wants a loan to expand the business. Faith M. operates a business of sugarcane growing and wants to boost business and increase output. Suzan N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To add to clothing business

loans.name: Mashalla

texts.en: Mashalla A. is a 59-year-old man who cultivates meadows in a small village in the Saatli region. He raises meadows and then sells them to the local farmers and bazaar traders. He has eight years of experience in this field. He applied for a loan of $1100 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Kirangira East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Shamim K.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to boost business. Shamim is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 5 children ranging from age 3 to 11 and her children go to school. Each week, Shamim makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build better business premises. Shamim has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Shamim is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Teopista N., Florence B., and Maiza B.. Sarah N. has a business in poultry farming and wants to purchase more chicks and feed. Teopista N. is currently operating a business rearing cows and wants a loan to buy more cows. Florence B. operates a poultry farming business and wants to add more capital. Maiza B. is currently in the business of sugarcane growing and is requesting a loan to purchase more farm supplies to increase output.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of charcoal sold

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali M. is a 39-year-old trader who runs his small food store in a small village in the Saatli region.  He is married and has three children.  He applied for a loan of  $1200 to improve the conditions of his workplace.

loans.use: To improve conditions of the store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mbakisya

texts.en:
Greetings from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Mbakisya M. is 41 years old. She is widowed and has three children, who are ages 7, 17, and 20. <> In 2006, Mbakisya established a tailoring business. Mbakisya has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requests a new loan in order to purchase materials, thread, needles, and other sewing accessories. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase materials and accessories for her tailoring business

loans.name: Naanjela

texts.en:
Greetings from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Naanjela M. is 28 years old. She is married and has three children, who are 9 months, 4, and 7 in age. 
 
In 2000, Naanjela established an African batik cloth business. She works 9 to 12 hours a day, two to three days a week, and is assisted by her husband and mother-in-law. Naanjela has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA.  She now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $260. In the future, Naanjela plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of African batik cloth in bulk

loans.name: Kirangira East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Emiraida M.. She is currently in the business of growing sugarcane and is requesting a loan to hire more land for cultivation. Emiraida is 37 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 4 to 12 and all her children go to school. Each week, Emiraida makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business. Emiraida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Emiraida is joined in her small group by Lydia B., Ruth N., Scovia A., and Aidah Kyaka. Lydia B. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes for sale. Ruth N. is currently operating a business in poultry farming and wants a loan to place an order for more chicks. Scovia A. operates a business of running a retail shop and wants to purchase more shop items. Aidah Kyaka is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy poultry feed.

loans.use: To boost sugarcane business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Greetings from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Asha M. is 49 years old. She is married and has four children, who are between the ages of 20 and 32. <> In 2004, Asha established a business as a seamstress. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, six days a week, and assisted by her husband and two employees, she earns about $350 per month. Asha has already received and successfully repaid four loans from SELFINA. She now requests a new loan in order to purchase material and sewing accessories to sew more clothes to sell. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $200. In the future, Asha plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase material and sewing accessories in order to make new clothes to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 23-year-old single lady who supports two children in her household. She spent one year learning the art of dressmaking and has been offering her tailoring services within her community in Kisumu, Kenya since 2002. She specializes in both women’s dresses and men’s shirts.

Despite the stiff competition in her area, Carolyne has always been able to attract old and new customers. Her hard work, years of experience and well-established clientele base ensure that her business will continue to succeed.

She plans to use a quarter of her loan of US $500 to purchase new patterns and materials, and also a new sewing machine, as the one she currently has is old.

loans.use: Purchase new patterns, materials and sewing machine.

loans.name: Virtudes

texts.en:
Virtudes is forty-five years old, and she and her husband have two children who attend school. For three years, Virtudes has been running a small business selling vegetables to people of Los Alcarrizos community of Santo Domingo. This poor section of Santo Domingo’s periphery is densely populated, and all the neighbors know one another. So, Virtudes’s business is very successful and much visited.

With her loan, Virtudes plans on purchasing more fresh vegetables to add to her current stock. She hopes to become the most well established supplier of these goods in her area.

loans.use: To increase stock in fresh vegetables

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Greetings from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Eva K. is 40 years old. She is single and has three children, who are ages 13, 17, and 20.

In 2005, Eva established a general store. Working 5 to 8 hours a day, seven days a week, and assisted by her niece, she earns about $210 per month from this business. Eva has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of sugar, oil, rice, cloth, and sarongs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $35.

About SELFINA SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, oil, sugar, cloth, and sarongs for her general store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose (shown standing attending to a client) is the proprietor of Beverly Hills Salon based in the Nyalenda slums in Kisumu, Kenya. She started her salon in 1997 from her small savings. The salon is located in a densely populated area on the way to Dunga beach. Rose lives with her husband and one school-going child.

Rose has applied for US $500 to enable her to renovate the salon which is in bad shape and also to purchase cosmetics and a hair drier.

loans.use: Renovate her salon and purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Getina

texts.en:
Greetings from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Getinda M. is 48 years odl. She is married and has four children, who are between the ages of 18 and 30. She has two other dependents, who are her nieces.

Getinda owns a barbecue chicken business. Getinda has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA. She now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional ingredients and utensils in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and utensils for her barbecue chicken business

loans.name: Aneesa's Group

texts.en: My name is Aneesa B. and I have five children, three sons and two daughters. All of my children are under the age of 15; three attend a local school and two are not yet of school age. I am a textile artist and create embroidered dresses that are embellished with sequins and beads. My brother sells these outfits at his shop in Karachi, a big city in Pakistan.  I need to increase my income by expanding my business. With the increased profits I hope to make, I plan to renovate my house and save for my children's future. The other members of my group who need loans are: Humaira B., who is borrowing for her husband's TV cable agency. Jameela B. plans to invest her share of this loan in her family’s paper business. Khailda B. runs a boutique. Rashida B. embroiders and makes clothing on order. This is a group loan and we are all responsible for repaying it.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business and several other small companies

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline O. is a 51 year old widow. She lives with her three living children at Dunga Beach Kisumu Kenya. She is famous for creating traditional mats made from locally available papyrus reeds. She has been in this business for the last 28 years.

Angeline normally makes an average of 16 to 20 mats a week. The mats are sold at wholesale price (an average of US $1.20 to US $19.00 a mat) to businessmen who buy in bulk to sell elsewhere. She requires US $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her mat business.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
My name is Zahida N. and I am a widow who lives in the mid-sized city of Multan, Pakistan. I am a mother of three: two boys and one girl. All of my children are under the age of 15 and attend a local school. I am the only breadwinner in my family and run a boutique. My income is just enough to cover my household expenses. I need to expand my business so that I can save for my children’s future and help them continue with their studies.    
The other women in my group are: Naila B., Saeeda  B. and Rani B.. All three run boutiques and are borrowing to expand and improve their businesses. These women work very hard to earn an income for their families. We have been together for one year and have learned to be punctual and responsible during this time.

loans.use: Expand four small boutiques

loans.name: Domina

texts.en:
Greetings from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Domina A. is 30 years old. She is married and has children, who are ages 4 and 10.

In 2005, Domina established a stationary and secretarial business. Domina has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her stationary and secretarial shop

loans.name: Nereah

texts.en: Nereah A. is a 55 year old widow. She lives with seven of her own children and four grandchildren at Dunga in Kisumu Kenya. She dropped her original business of selling fish due to competition from other traders. In 2007 she started making traditional mats which are locally used by the community. She plans to boost her current business and also supplement it with cereal sales, currently in high demand, using the US $600 she has applied for.

loans.use: Boost her current business of selling mats and supplement with cereal sales.

loans.name: Firdos' Group

texts.en: My name is Firdos A.. I am married and have eight children, six boys and two girls. I live with my family in Multan, a mid-sized city in Southern Punjab, a province of Pakistan. One of my sons runs a TV cable agency and we need a loan to expand his business. I am borrowing in a group that includes three other women: Zarina I. runs a boutique. Laiqa N. is borrowing to expand her husband’s auto workshop. Arjaman B. also operates a boutique. These women are poor and need loans to expand their companies. Please help us secure the required amount of our loan and grow our businesses.

loans.use: Expand a TV cable agency and three other small businesses

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica O. is a very active 40-year old member of her community. She has lived in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya for the past fifteen years. She is married and heads a household of five school-aged children.

In 1997 she received training from KMET for home-based HIV/AIDS care, TB ambassadorship and community-based distribution of oral contraceptives. Monica is very well-known within her community for her compassionate work.

Her main business and source of income is selling fish which she started doing in 1993. Given her reputation and the location of her business along the shores of Lake Victoria her business has flourished. Monica credits her success on hard work and the assistance she has received from KMET through two previous micro-finance loans. She plans to use the funds from her next loan of US $600 to expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a widow living with her six children at Dunga Kisumu Kenya. Besides selling dry fish she also sells cereals and has been doing so for fifteen years. She normally buys dry maize, rice, and beans in bulk during harvesting season when prices are low and sells when the prices increase.

She plans to invest part of the loan for USD $600 to purchase more cereals such as beans and rice and save part of it to use in case of emergencies.

loans.use: Purchase cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Please Delete Group

texts.en:
Mwanaheri H. , age 30, is married with 3 children (ages 11,7 and 3). She has a table top business which she began 6 months ago. Her business is open from 10am to 9pm daily, making a monthly profit of about US$52.

In the past, Mwanaheri has taken out 3 previuos loans from Tujijenge Tanzanain to start the table top business. She hopes to receive a new loan to increase on the same business. She will share this loan with her sun-group members with businesses of selling fish, shoes, shops and charcoal.

In the picture, Mwanaheri is 1st on the right

loans.use: to increase on capital

loans.name: Kazi Za Jamii D Group

texts.en:
Mwanaheri H. , age 30, is married with 3 children (ages 11, 7 and 3). She has a tabletop business which she began 6 months ago. Her business is open from 10am to 9pm daily, making a monthly profit of about $52.

In the past, Mwanaheri has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to start the tabletop business. She hopes to receive a new loan to grow the same business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, with businesses selling fish, shoes, and charcoal.

In the picture, Mwanaheri is first on the right.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman H. is a 40-year-old farmer who breeds sheep in a small village of the Saatli region. He has been selling sheep for meat to the local people and to the local bazaar traders since 2002.  He applied for a loan of $1100 to build a good shed to keep his herd in normal conditions.

loans.use: To build a good shed to keep sheep in

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Qiyas

texts.en: Qiyas H. is a 51-year-old farmer who breeds horses and sells them to the local farmers. He has eight years of experience in this field. Mostly, people in villages purchase horses for plowing.  It takes a lot of time and strength to raise a good horse.  And sometimes, profit from selling one horse is just enough to feed the family. Qiyas decided to apply for a $1200 loan to purchase more foals to raise.

loans.use: To purchase foals to raise

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Tofiq A. is a 49-year-old farmer who sells milk and yogurt to the local bazaar traders. He also breeds calves. He has ten years of experience in this field. He lives with his family in a small village in the Saatli region. He applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase one milker cow for $600 and two baby calves for $300 each.

loans.use: To purchase one milker cow and two baby calves.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo works in the Royal Cafe. He is in charge of electronic maintenance and also performs the maintenance on the computers.

His home is located in the Alto Obrajez zone of the city of La Paz.

He is single and is finishing his university studies. The credit he receives will be used to buy a computer that will help him to do his final thesis as well as do some computation work.

This is the first time that he has asked for credit from Impro.

His work and the desire to do better for himself have permitted him to get this credit and with this help, improve his income and his way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, kiva.org volunteer. Pablo trabaja en café Royal como encargado de mantenimiento electrónico y también realiza mantenimiento de computadoras. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltero y esta culminando sus estudios universitarios. El crédito será destinado para la compra de una computadora que le ayudará para la elaboración de sus tesis de grado, como para la elaboración de algunos trabajos de computación. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que con esta ayuda mejoraran sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy a computer to help with his studies

loans.name: Leon

texts.es:
Leon is retired and also has a business where he makes desserts, cakes and traditional corn meal items. His wife and children help him with the work when there are many orders.

His home is located in the Cota Cota zone in the city of La Paz.

This is the fifth time that he has asked for credit. His history has qualified him as a number 1 client, that is to say that he has a good payment history. The credit will be used as capital for his work (flour, sugar, milk, eggs, spices, leavening and others). It will also allow him to install a store in his home.

His work and his desire to grow his business has permitted him to get this credit, which will help to increase his income and his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. León es jubilado y también tiene un negocio donde elabora pasteles, tortas y masitas, su esposa e hijos le ayudan en el trabajo de elaboración cuando tiene mucho pedido. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Harina, Azúcar, leche, huevos, esencias, levadura y otros). Y le permitirá instalar su tienda en su domicilio. Su trabajo y las ganas de crecer en su negocio le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que con esta ayuda mejoraran sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy food products such as flour, eggs, sugar, milk, etc. for his bakery

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción works as a seamstress in a clothing factory. This is her main source of income with which she supports her three children. Her home is located in the Villa Ingavi zone of the city of El Alto.

She needs a loan to buy construction materials so that she can finish work on her small home and make it more liveable.

This is her second loan with IMPRO, her prior credit record allows her to be approved for another loan. She is a client of IMPRO since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Concepción, trabaja como costurera en una fabrica de confección de ropa por temporada. Esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Villa Ingavi de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para comprar materia de construcción, para terminar con la obra fina de su pequeña vivienda familiar y hacerla más habitable.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el antecedentes anterior le faculta para aprobarle otro préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006

loans.use: Purchase materials to complete work on her home.

loans.name: Kazi Za Jamii B Group

texts.en:
Husna J., age 30, is married with 5 children (ages 15, 11, 8, 4 and 3). She has a charcoal business which she began 8 years ago. Her business is open from 7am to 6pm daily, making her a monthly profit of around $61.

In the past, Husna has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business and she also opened a small nursery school. She hopes for a new loan to increase capital. She will share this loan with her sub-group members dealing in charcoal sales, food sales, pharmacy and a shop.

In the picture, Husna is second from left (back row).

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Biljana

texts.en: Biljana is 38 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in Trno, near the town Laktaši. Her children are both in primary school. Her husband has a permanent job and earns a monthly income of 700 KM. Biljana runs a small bookkeeping shop, and plans to use this loan to renovate her office. This will ensure better working conditions and allow her to offer more services to her clients.

loans.use: Renovation of a bookkeeping office.

loans.name: Gordana

texts.en: Gordana is 41 years old and lives in the village Šušnjari, near Laktaši. Her husband is permanently employed and earns a monthly income of 900 KM. The family also earns an additional 200 KM a month from agricultural work. They have one child, who goes to secondary school. Gordana owns a boutique, but needs a loan to buy clothing to sell to her customers. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her family's income and build a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Buy clothes to sell in a small boutique.

loans.name: Fiordalina

texts.en:
Fiordalina is a much experienced businesswoman who lives in the Los Alcarrizos community of Santo Domingo. She has been selling fried vegetables with pork meat for more than ten years, and this business is her principal source of income. A few months ago, Fiordalina took a loan from FSMA that she used to increase her supply of ingredients, giving a boost to her business. She now produces and sells more food, and as a result her income has increased significantly.

Fiordalina is requesting a new loan to purchase more raw ingredients in order to keep boosting her business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is forty-four years old and she and her husband have two girls aged twenty-two and twenty-six years. Celestina has been selling women’s clothing and men's and women's shoes in her community for more than three years. She says that doing business is the only way she knows to lift her family from poverty. “We can’t wait for others or the government to do something for us; we have to work a lot to earn our living,” she says.

Until now, Celestina has operated her business from her house, but she plans to rent another location someday to make her goods more accessible to her customers. With her loan, Celestina will buy clothing in bulk to continue to build her business.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of clothing for sale

loans.name: Tomasina

texts.en:
Tomasina, a forty-seven-year-old mother of five children, sells a collection of fashionable shoes to the men and women of her community. Tomasina purchases her stock in response to her customers' orders and sells them from her house. She has been selling these goods for two years and now she a well-established clientele. With the profits from the business, Tomasina helps her husband to support the household and the children's studies.

With her loan, Tomasina will buy a showcase to display her shoes for sale.

loans.use: To improve a retail shoe business

loans.name: Virtudes

texts.en:
Virtudes is a twenty-four-year-old budding businesswoman and mother of two girls aged four and two years. Recently, Virtudes started a small business selling fried vegetables with chicken and pork. She modestly explains that her clientele is still limited, but she manages to make the business profitable and says she will work harder to move it forward.

With her loan, Virtudes will buy fresh vegetables, vegetable oil, fuel for the heater with which she prepares the goods, and other items to continue her business. Virtudes hopes she’ll increase her income so that she can pay the school tuition for her children.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
With the idea of helping economically with the maintenance of her home, Juana opened a small store five years ago. Before this she worked solely in the home. However, seeing the needs of her entire family, she thought it would be a good idea to start a business. Over time she has been in charge of moving forward with the little that she had and now happily sees the growth of her four children thanks to the help of her store.

If it is possible, Juana will make her store bigger this year. She would like to stock it with more products and display cases so that is looks nicer and as such, attracts more clients. For this, she would need around $750 of financing.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, kiva.org volunteer. Con la idea de ayudar económicamente al mantenimiento de su hogar, hace cinco años, Juana abrió su pequeña bodega. Antes de eso ella se dedicaba íntegramente a su casa. Sin embargo, al ver las necesidades por las que pasaba su familia entera pensó que sería buena idea emprender un negocio. Así, en el transcurso de este tiempo ella se ha encargado de sacar a adelante lo poco que tenia y ahora ve con alegría crecer a sus cuatro hijos gracias a la ayuda de su tienda. De ser posible, Juana agrandaría su tienda durante este año. Quisiera implementarla con más productos y vitrinas para que se vea más vistosa y por lo tanto, atraiga más clientes. Para esto, ella necesitaría alrededor de $750 de financiamiento.

loans.use: Improve location, buy display cabinets and more products.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is married and has seven children. Cattle rearing is what he does to get income.

The previous loans enabled Abubakar to increase his livestock by two cows. He is now requesting a larger loan to purchase and sell more cows.

Abubakar said if he can purchase two or three cows bi-weekly and sell them, he would get a good profit.

His plan is to increase his business and also family livestock. Abubakar is 48 years old.

loans.use: Abubakar needs to increase the number of cattle he can buy and sell in order to support his family.

loans.name: Bailoh

texts.en:
Bailoh is 35 years old and married with five children. She started her business at the age of 15 and continued running the same business after she got married.

She has a small store of general merchandise in Dogolia village of Sierra Leone. In addition to the small shop, Bailoh sells cotton African print materials and sauce pans in various villages during market days.

She is requesting another loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Bailoh wants to further expand her newly diversified business to provide enough supplies to meet the growing demand.

loans.name: Ishaka

texts.en:
Ishaka is 42 years old and married with four children. He trades sheep and goats.

Before his previous loan, Ishaka used to take the animals on credit. After the loan, he has made his purchases in cash and has been able to earn a good profit.

With the profit, he purchased two goats for his family and he plans to keep them for reproduction. He is requesting a loan of (Le.600,000) to continue with his business.

loans.use: Ishaka needs additional capital to continue moving his business forward.

loans.name: Saliue

texts.en:
Saliue is married with five children.

With his previous loan, he was able generate income from buying and selling goats and sheep, and he purchased one cow.

Because Saliue has a good repayment record of his previous loan and experience in his business, he is requesting $1,200 (Le.3,500,000) to diversify his animal trade and increase his stock and income.

loans.use: Saliue is an experienced businessman who needs additional capital to further expand his business.

loans.name: Salieu

texts.en:
Salieu is 55 years old and married with four children. He buys cows from the village and sells them in Freetown.

His previous loan enabled him to purchase two cows a month for sale. This has reduced time needed for transporting/traveling to Freetown.

Mr. J. is requesting a loan of $1,200 (Le.3,500,000) to increase his stock and thus reduce time for traveling.

Mr. J. is also a chairman of a loan recovery committee in the village. He oversees that clients repay their loans to SMT on time. For a year and half, loan recovery in Dogolia village has been 100 percent.

loans.use: Salieu wants to reduce his time and costs for traveling to buy cattle by purchasing more at one time.  He needs additional capital to do so.

loans.name: Yorobailo

texts.en:
Yorobailo is 45 years old and married with four children. He owns a small pharmacy, selling basic medicines in the village of Dogolia in Koinadugu, Sierra Leone.

Yorobailo increased his stock with the previous loan and would like to do the same if he could get a loan of $300 (Le.800,000).

Yorobailo’s business provides medications to those in the community who could not get medicines from the village health clinics.

loans.use: Yorobailo is providing a very important service to his community and needs assistance to purchase medications.

loans.name: Alhaji Ibrahim

texts.en:
Alhaji is 35 years old and married with three children. He buys and sells cows to traders who come from Freetown.

Alhaji used to take a cow on credit and would pay the balance after selling it. With a previous loan loan, which was insufficient to purchase a mature cow, Alhaji used the small amount of capital to diversify his business and sell goods on the side.

Although he is earning a small income for his family, it does not enable him to build his own capital. On many occasions, the cattle suppliers have not given him the cows on credit.

For this reason, he is requesting for a loan of $350 (Le.1,000,000) to expand his business and build capital.

loans.use: Alhaji needs additional business capital to continue the expansion and growth of his business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim D. is 37 years old and married with three children.

He sells sheep in the village market of Dogolia in Sierra Leone.

With the previous loan, he managed to earn some profit and purchase three small sheep. Ibrahim is requesting another loan to increase his livestock.

loans.use: Ibrahim needs additional business capital to increase his inventory of livestock for selling.

loans.name: Bailoh Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 45 years old and married with five children.

He owns a small shop in the village of Dogolia in Koinadugu, Sierra Leone.

With the previous loans, he was able to increase his stock and profit and is requesting another loan to expand his business.

loans.use: Mr. Jalloh  needs additional capital to enhance his business and increase his stock.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Before opening up her convenience store business, Rita sold fish. Because of health problems she had to leave that work. For a period of time she was jobless, although she never stopped thinking about how she could continue to help out economically to raise her five young children.

About three years ago, she got the idea of putting a small store in her own home, and she did this. Starting off little by little, today she manages a convenience store. Rita has always dreamed of progressing, and that is why she plans to set up an area in the entrance of her home to sell food during the day. With the help of her husband and her children, she has enough support and confidence in her plan to make it happen.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Antes de abrir el negocio de su bodega, Rita trabajaba vendiendo pescados. No fue sino por problemas de salud que se vio obligada a dejarlo. Por un periodo estuvo sin trabajo, aunque nunca dejo de pensar cómo podría seguir ayudando económicamente en la crianza de sus cinco menores hijos.

Hace alrededor de tres años, se le ocurrió la idea de poner una pequeña tienda en su propia casa. Y así lo hizo. Empezando de a pocos, hoy maneja su bodega. En Rita siempre habito el sueño de mejorar y progresar, por esto planea ambientar el hall en la entrada de su casa para vender comida durante el día. Con la ayuda de su esposo y de sus hijos ella tiene suficiente apoyo y confianza de que su plan se concretará.

loans.use: Set up an area in her home for selling food.

loans.name: Makete B Group

texts.en:
Kezia Fungo, age 25, owns a salon business which she started 7 years ago. She works from 7am to 8pm daily, and is able to make a monthly profit of about $779.

In the past, Kezia has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy equipment for the salon. She hopes for a new loan for further business expansion. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses in the sale of groceries, clothes and poultry, and a restaurant.

In the picture Kezia is in the middle.

loans.use: For further business expansion

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama S., a widow with six children, makes soap in the outskirts of Kabala in Sierra Leone.

Her business is the only source of income for her family. With several small loans, Adama was able to generate income and has built a house for her family.

Because of high demand and to earn more income, Adama would like to increase her production and is therefore requesting for a loan of $1,050 (Le.3,000,000).

loans.use: Adama has been able to create a business for herself and needs additional capital to continue increasing her production of soaps.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly has always devoted her attention to working in a grocery store. When she was a girl, she helped her aunt in the business that she ran. This is how she learned everything relevant to maintaining a grocery store. Once she got married, she decided to open her own store that today, after twelve years, fills her with pride. Although it has caused her a lot of effort, it also has filled her with satisfaction.

Today, her two daughters of twenty and eleven years learn from her and help her whenver they can. Thanks to the success of her business, she has been able to finish building her house and educate her daughters. In the future, she wants to open a beer distributing company in another location. Her plans for this year are to convert her store into a bazaar and to start selling school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde siempre, Magaly se dedicó a la atención de una bodega. Cuando niña, ella ayudaba a su tía en el negocio que esta manejaba. Es así que aprendió todo lo referente al mantenimiento de una bodega. Una vez que contrajo matrimonio, se animo a abrir una tienda que hoy, después de doce años, la llena de orgullo. Pues, aunque le causo mucho esfuerzo también la ha llenado de satisfacciones.

Hoy, son sus dos hijas de veinte y once años quienes aprenden de ella ayudándola cada vez que pueden. Pues, es gracias al éxito de su negocio que ella ha podido terminar de construir su casa y darle educación a sus hijas. En el futuro ella quiere abrir una distribuidora de cervezas en otro local. Por ahora, los planes para este año es convertir su bodega en bazar, implementándola de útiles escolares.

loans.use: To convert her grocery store into a bazaar.

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
Lamin sells jewels and cosmetics in Kabala in Sierra Leone.

Married with a wife and six children, Lamin has to generate sufficient income to meet his family's expenses. With his last loan, Lamin was able to purchase more goods and sell them on wholesale to retailers in the villages.

He would like to increase his wholesale activity and also involve his wife in the business. He is therefore requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1,000,000) for that purpose.

loans.use: Lamin has a vision of working in partnership with his wife to run the business and to increase his wholesale activities.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is 27 years old and married with three children. Ramatu said her business has increased after joining the SMT program. With the profit, she bought a dressing mirror and beds for her children.

Her plan is to expand her business for more income so that she can support her elderly parents. Ramatu’s regular income is insufficient to support the family expenses so her business supplements that.

She is requesting a loan for $525 (Le.1,500,000) to expand the business.

loans.use: Ramatu needs to buy additional supplies of shoes to sell in her shop, and additional capital would help her to do so.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is married with a child. He joined SMT a year ago and, with the previous loans, he has increased his stock and profit.

With the profit, he purchased a piece of land on the outskirts of Kabala in Sierra Leone.

Edward plans to build a house for his family and is requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1,000,000) to increase his stock and diversify the business.

loans.use: Edward wants to buy an extra supply of plastic sandals for selling in his shop.  He needs additional capital to be able to purchase the shoes.

loans.name: Aquila

texts.es:
Eight years ago, Aquila was left without a job due to the elimination of her position as a street vendor. She used to sell imported goods in the center of the city, but everything changed when the mayor of the district ordered the abandonment of informal positions. This is why she thought about opening a business in her house. Now her business is 7-years-old, and it is very well assorted. In spite of her age, she doesn't let tiredness lessen her daily labors.

Now she lives with only her 23-year-old son, who goes to school and works at the same time. This is why she usually manages her store by herself. Even with all of this, she still has plans. With a loan of $700, she will remodel her store and fill it with more products so it will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Fue por el desalojo de su puesto ambulante que Aquila se quedó sin trabajo hace ya ocho años. Ella solía vender cosas importadas en el centro de la ciudad, pero todo cambió cuando el alcalde del distrito ordenó el abandono de los puestos informales. De este modo, fue que pensó en abrir un negocio en su casa. Ya con casi siete años, su negocio se ve muy surtido. Ella, a pesar de su edad, no deja que el cansancio disminuya sus labores cotidianas. En la actualidad vive solamente con su menor hijo de veintitrés años, quien a la vez estudia y trabaja. Es por eso que la bodega normalmente la maneja ella sola. Con todo y esto, ella aun tiene planes. Con un préstamo de $ 700 ella remodelaría su tienda y la llenaría de más productos para que crezca.

loans.use: To improve her store and supply it further

loans.name: Hassanatu

texts.en:
Hassanatu sells clothes in the town of Kabala and has been in business for three years.

With her previous loans from SMT, she has increased her stock and income. Hassanatu said she was able to use the profit to buy a small refrigerator for cooling water for sale in the market. This has diversified her business.

With her husband’s business income, both are able to provide for their family with three meals a day. Hassanatu is therefore requesting another loan of $525 (Le.1,500,000) to diversify her clothing business further.

Hassanatu is 37 years old with two children.

loans.use: Hassanatu wants a variety of items for sale within her clothing shop and needs additional funding to do so.

loans.name: Lansana

texts.en:
Lansana has been in the business of selling cosmetics for five years. With several small loans from SMT, Lansana has increased his stock and profit.

He runs his business in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. He is requesting for a loan of $1,200 (Le. 3,500,000) to expand the business.

Lansana is 33 years old and married with three children.

loans.use: Lansana wants to enhance his profits and increase his business.  Additional business capital is the key to him achieving success.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Previously, Maritza sold beauty products by catalog. Nevertheless, at 45-years-old, she decided to start a business selling food. Always thinking about the well-being of her two children, she started to buy what was necessary for her restaurant along with her sister.

Little by little, they first invited their family members to the restaurant, then their close friends, who recommended their place. In this way, and thanks to their good service, they started to become known, and now they don't lack clients. On the contrary, sometimes she needs help keeping her supplies stocked, especially on weekends. Now, after 4 years, the dining room in her house is very small. With the goal of opening a location on the second floor of her house, Maritza and her sister work and even take orders because they need to gather a large sum of money.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Anteriormente, vendía productos de belleza por catálogo. Sin embargo, un día, a sus 45 años, Maritza decidió ingresar al negocio de la venta de comidas. Siempre pensando en el bienestar de sus dos hijos, junto con su hermana, empezó a comprar lo necesario para su restaurante. Poco a poco, primero fueron invitando a su restaurante a familiares, luego a sus amigos cercanos, quienes a la vez, recomendaban el lugar. Fue así y además, gracias a su buen servicio, que se iban haciendo conocidas y ahora no hay día que le falten clientes. Por el contrario algunas veces necesita ayuda para abastecerse, en especial los fines de semana. Luego de cuatro años, el comedor de su casa ya queda muy chico. Con el propósito de abrir un local en el segundo piso de su casa, Maritza y su hermana trabajan incluso a pedido pues necesitan reunir una suma fuerte de dinero.

loans.use: To fix up the second floor of her house as a bigger location for her restaurant

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a sixty-six-year-old untiring businesswoman who strives for a better life in spite of difficulty and frustration. She lost her husband a couple of years ago and was left with five children for whom she is the sole support. Currently, Amelia runs a grocery store for the people in her community, who purchase different kinds of products such as detergent, bath soap, chocolate candy bars, instant powdered drink and foodstuffs such as rice, flour and vegetables. Amelia explains that her dream is to have a “Big Store” with millions of products and millions of loyal customers to visit it daily. “I know that I have to work much more than now to achieve this goal,” she says, “but I am optimistic and persistent.”

Amelia will use her loan to buy more products to replenish her store and keep building her business.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to replenish a grocery store.

loans.name: Rosa Iris

texts.en:
Rosa Iris is a brilliant entrepreneur who sells silver jewelry to women of the Los Alcarrizos community of Santo Domingo. Rosa and her husband have three boys, aged 10, 12 and 14 years, who attend school. Rosa began her business about two years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough to bear all the expenses of the family. Sometimes people go to her house to buy the jewelry, but the most of the time, Rosa visits her friends, neighbors or others in the area to offer and sell her goods.

Rosa wants to expand her business in order to attract more people and increase her income. With the loan, Rosa will buy more silver jewelry as well as a collection of women’s underwear to diversify to her inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry and women's underwear to expand a small business.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Two weeks ago Jacinta's business was robbed. Some criminals broke in and stole equipment from the calling center that she had opened with her son. The store had been open just five months.

Jacinta tells us that it was her son who gave her the idea of having a calling center. At first he rented cell phone equipment at his university, but because of the competition he faced, he decided to buy a stand and to do that same business from his home. When she saw how well things were going, his mother thought of opening her own calling center. Thanks to a loan from EDAPROSPO, they were able to buy the necessary equipment.

Jacinta is a hard-working woman and in addition to managing this business, she has an internet cafe business and for the past 28 years has run a convenience store. Because of these businesses, the losses from the robbery are not affecting her too much and she knows very well how to get up and start over again. Among her plans are to improve the layout of her calling center so that it has more security.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Hace dos semanas la señora Jacinta sufrió un robo en su negocio. Unos maleantes entraron y le robaron los equipos del locutorio que abrió junto a su hijo. El local recién cumple cinco meses de inaugurado.

Jacinta cuenta que fue su hijo quien le dio la idea de tener un locutorio. Al inicio él alquilaba equipos de celulares en su universidad, pero frente a una gran competencia decidió comprar un módulo y hacer lo mismo afuera de su casa. Al ver que le iba bien pensó con su mamá abrir su locutorio. Gracias a un préstamo que EDAPROSPO les brindo pudieron comprar los equipos necesarios.

Jacinta es una mujer muy trabajadora, además de manejar este negocio alquila cabinas de internet y atiende también en una bodega hace 28 años. Por eso, la perdida que sufrió con el robo no le afecta mucho, pues sabe muy bien como levantarse y volver a empezar. En sus planes esta mejorar la infraestructura de su locutorio para que tenga más seguridad.

loans.use: Improve the layout of her business to make it safer.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni is a woman who is at once admirable. The strength she show when she speaks gives clear testimony to her work and the effort she puts into it so that everything goes well.

For two years she has been selling gas. It all began with the idea of providing a better education for her three childen, who are fifteen, thirteen and five years old. Half of her income is for them and the rest is saved, since she has plans that she would like to fulfill. At her 39 years, her dream is to open a gift store as well as to buy what she needs to be able to sell sandwiches at night. She has no doubt about the help her husband and children will give her in this.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Marleni es una mujer que a primera vista resulta admirable. Esas fuerzas que demuestra al hablar brindan un claro testimonio de su trabajo y las ganas que le pone para que todo vaya bien.

Hace ya dos años que vende gas. Todo empezó con la idea de darle una mejor educación a sus hijos de quince, trece y cinco años. La mitad de sus ingresos lo destina a ellos y lo demás lo ahorra, pues tiene planes que desea realizar. A sus treinta y nueve años, el sueño de ella es abrir una tienda bazar y además comprar lo necesario para vender sanguches por las noches. Para esto ella no duda de la ayuda que su esposo e hijos le pueden brindar.

loans.use: Open a gift shop.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
When she was young Julia used to watch her mother selling at her convenience store. Her mother was always her idol, an example to follow. She thought that one day she would also have a store. However, because of her work taking care of her six children, it took her a while to achieve this dream.

She started little by little, selling ice cream from her home for a time, and later she also sold cookies and other products, always in small quantities. Two years ago she was able to open her convenience store. Thanks to this, she helps her husband maintain the household and raise their children.

Always with the idea of progressing and growing, she plans to add a photocopier and a public telephone.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Desde pequeña Julia solía ver a su mamá vendiendo en su bodega. Siempre la tuvo como su ideal, su ejemplo a seguir. Así que ella pensó en que algun dia tendría una tambien. Sin embargo, la tarea de madre de cuidar a sus seis hijos que tuvo, tardo un poco en cumplir el sueño que tenia desde niña.

Poco a poco empezó vendiendo marcianos en su casa por una temporada, luego también algunas galletas y más productos, siempre en pequeñas cantidades. Hasta que hace dos años llego a abrir su bodega. Gracias a ella, ayuda a su esposo en el mantenimiento del hogar y la crianza de sus hijos.

Siempre, con la idea de progresar y crecer, planea comprar una fotocopiadora y un teléfono público.

loans.use: Buy a photocopier and install a public telephone.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a woman in her late thirties; she and her husband have two children, a boy and a girl, both of whom attend school. Her husband works from home as a carpenter. To supplement the family’s income, Juana sells beauty products to the women in her community. She usually visits friends and other women of the community to sell her goods. Juana explains that her children are still young and they need all the support she can provide them.
