loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Santos Antonio

texts.es:
Don Santos is a native of the community of San José de los Ríos. He dedicates himself to agriculture. He spends the majority of his time on pineapple production in the fertile lands of Ticuantepe, where the climate is very favorable for the harvest of said product. He possesses 20 years experience in the cultivation of pineapple, which involves an artisan manufacturing process that requires a lot of investment since the maintenance of of land must be paid for constantly. Also the land must be fumigated so that said harvest is not destroyed. The earnings that he obtains from the sale of his products vary according to the time at which products are harvested. His earnings go toward surviving and supporting his three children and his wife, who takes care of the kids and their home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Don Santos es originario de la comunidad de San José de los Ríos, se dedica a la agricultura, su actividad principal en la que basa su mayor tiempo es a la producción de piña, producto asentado en las fértiles tierras de Ticuantepe, en donde el clima le es muy favorable para cosechar dicho producto, posee 20 años de experiencia en el cultivo de la piña, el cual conlleva un proceso artesanal manufacturero que requiere de mucha inversión, ya que el mantenimiento de las manzanas de tierra deben de abonarse constantemente así como también fumigar para que dicha cosecha no se dañe, los ingresos que obtiene por la venta de su producto varían de acuerdo a la época en que saca la producción, para poder sobrevivir y mantener a sus tres hijos y a su esposa, quien cuida de los hijos y la vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase chemical fertilizers and insecticides to prevent pests or fungi.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is single with a grown son who is married. She lives in Simferopol, Crimea. Anna decided to try her luck in business after the collapse of the Soviet Union. Today she sells household items, clothing and shoes, cosmetics, and other merchandise at a local city market near the train station. Anna has been in this business for 17 years. Currently, her income is about $2000 a month. She has about $20,000 in inventory.

Anna would like to work hard and persist in her entrepreneurial efforts so that she can build a good credit history with Nadiya Ukraine and be able to expand her business with financial assistance she receives through loans. Today she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase household inventory from the local wholesalers in Simferopol. She is hoping to generate enough profit to buy an apartment for her son and daughter-in-law. One of Anna’s long-term plans for the future is to open her own little retail store.

loans.use: Purchase Inventory

loans.name: Linoora

texts.en:
Linoora is married with a grown daughter. She sells construction tools in the central market of Simferopol. Some of the best attractions of her business are her neat arrangements of inventory, reasonable prices and her friendly approach to each customer. Linoora has been in this trade for 3 years. She has about $3000 in inventory. Her income is about $400 a month.

Linoora is seeking a loan of $500 to purchase additional screwdrivers, drills, wrenches, tape-lines, brushes, knives, screws, and other tools. She believes this loan will help her grow her business and provide her customers with necessary tools for everyday life. Moreover, Linoora is hoping to use a portion of her generated profit to invest in the construction of a private house for her and her husband and the legal privatization of their land lot, which can be a time-consuming and a costly thing to do.

loans.use: Purchase tools for inventory

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi is single with a daughter who is grown. He is from Simferopol, Crimea. Valeryi sells sportswear in the local train station market. This market is always busy with clients. Valeryi offers a nice selection of merchandise for sale and arranges it beautifully in his kiosk which attracts many potential customers. Valeryi has been in this trade for 13 years. He has about $10,000 in inventory. His monthly income is about $800.

Valeryi is requesting a loan of $500 for a two-month period. He is planning to purchase 20 jackets from wholesalers in Odessa. One of his business plans is to open a second vending facility and hire a sales person to work as a market vendor in the same market. With increased sales and profits, Valeryi will be able to open an additional vending kiosk and improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: Purchase 20 jackets from wholesalers

loans.name: Uryi

texts.en:
Uriy supports his wife and two children with a business selling and installing small natural gas water-heating units. He started his business about seven years ago at a time when he and his family were experiencing some financial difficulties. Since then, he has developed a successful, profitable business. He has about $4000 invested in his business and earns around $1200 per month. With the rapidly growing economy that Ukraine has been experiencing, many people are upgrading and remodeling their homes and businesses. The units Uriy sells are a popular way to modernize both heating and hot water arrangements.

Uriy has requested a loan to help purchase a bulk supply of plastic piping that he uses to install the heating units. His business has grown and been successful due in part to the financial assistance he has received through Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this new opportunity to assist him with his enterprise.

loans.use: Purchase bulk supply of plastic piping

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is a focused, hard-working taxi driver from Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine. He is from a family of taxi drivers. Both his father and older brother as well as his father-in-law are all taxi drivers. Vladimir started driving a taxi about 11 years ago. He purchased his first taxi, a Russian brand called Moskvich, for about $3000. Since that time he has owned ten different vehicles and has never had an accident while driving a taxi. He is respected among his fellow taxi drivers and is currently involved in a leadership capacity with one of the radio taxi dispatching companies in Ivano-Frankivsk. Vladimir is married and has a son who is nine. We would say his son has a good chance of growing up to be a third-generation taxi driver!

Vladimir has requested a loan to help cover the purchase and registration costs of a new taxi vehicle he recently bought. This new vehicle is an upgrade over his previous car and is the type of vehicle passengers prefer for long-distance trips. This loan will help Vladimir continue to offer high quality transportation services around Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine and Europe.

loans.use: Help with purchasing and registration costs of new taxi

loans.name: Mohammad Nasar

texts.en:
Mohammad Nasar lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of one son. He has a food shop; he makes cookies and different kinds of Afghani food and sells it at the bazaar.

His business is small so he wants to expand it. For this reason he has requested an individual loan to enlarge his business and have more foods to sell at the bazaar. He is intent on making a good income to make a bright future for his family.

loans.use: To expand his little homemade food business

loans.name: Mohammad Halam

texts.en:
Mohammad Halam lives with his own family in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a metal shop, a business he started 8 years ago. He has good numbers of clients and also he has good contacts with construction companies in Kabul.

Mohammad Halam would like to enlarge his business so he wants to take an individual loan to complete the materials and supplies he is lacking and make a good income to be successful in his business and also in his life. He is happy.

loans.use: To complete materials he is lacking

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 43 years old he has 4 children, all studying in schools. One of them was injured in a car explosion seven months ago and it was a very bad injury. The entrepreneur has a small general store in his house and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new ice box and more goods, expand and paint his shop, and make new shelves. He wants to improve his business and increase his family's income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new ice box and more goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 30 years old he is married and has two daughters, one of them studying in primary school. He is living in a rented house and his old father lives with him. He has an old taxi and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new engine and new tires, and to paint and renovate the taxi. He wants to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new engine and new tires

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Thân, 51, lives in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An with her husband and 3 children. She is a 4th year TYM member. Her main occupation is raising piglets and calves. Each year she sells 3-4 batches of pigs, each batch brings her 500-600 USD. She also raises calves until they mature and sells for a good profit. Her husband works in the rice filed and helps her out whenever he has free time. 1 of their children still goes to school. Their family income is 150 USD a month. Mrs Thân is requesting a loan of 525 USD to buy piglets and mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thân, 51 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Hoạt động chủ yếu của chị Thân là chăn nuôi các loại gia súc như: lợn, bò. Một năm chị bán từ 3 đến 4 lứa lợn, mỗi lứa cho thu nhập 500-600USD. Ngoài ra chị mua bê chăm cho đến khi được giá sẽ bán. Chồng chị ngoài thời gian làm việc đồng áng cũng phụ giúp vợ tích cực trong việc chăn nuôi. Hai anh chị có 1 cháu còn đang đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình 150USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Thân xin vay 525USD để mua lợn con và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy piglets and mash.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.en:
María Lourdes is one of the few older women who give special importance to education. In spite of her age – she’s fifty years old – María Lourdes attends school for adults and she will finish secondary school next year. María Lourdes, a mother of five well-loved children, is also an entrepreneur. She sells men’s and women’s clothing in the Batey de Palavé community of San Cristobal. The entrepreneur has been running this business for six years, shortly after her husband’s death.

Marie Lourdes explains that there are a lot of entrepreneurs who are competing to attract the customers and to be the best supplier of clothing in the community. She adds that she’ll do her best to lead in this competition and have a successful business.

With her loan, Marie Lourdes will buy more clothing for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk to restock a small business.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en: Solmaz A. is 45-year-old woman, is married and has one son. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She has been settled with her family in Beylagan city since 1993. She and her husband, Mr. Pirali, are engaged in animal breeding. (Her husband is pictured). Mr. Pirali purchases animals from the livestock market of Beylagan, raises them for some months and then sells them again.They established their business ten years ago. Now they need a loan in amount of $1200 to purchase more sheep and expand their business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif G. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. He has been settled with his family in Beylagan since 1993. Vagif is a-45 year-old man, is married and has three children. He is engaged in animal breeding and sales. Vagif purchases animals from the livestock market of Beylagan, raises them for some months and then sells them again. (He is pictured at the livestock market). Vagif applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan in amount of $700 to purchase some sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 24 years old and is single. He lives with his parents. Elchin is engaged in cattle breeding. He started his business because he needed to help out even more with the family expenses. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan in amount of $600 to purchase some sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase some sheep

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir S. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 23 years old and is single. He lives with his parents. Mahir is engaged in cattle breeding. He started his business two years ago. His father helps him at his business. Mahir would like to purchase two calves and increase the number of his cows. Because of this he applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in amount of $400. He hopes this loan will help him to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Askerkhan

texts.en: Askerkhan Z. lives in the Devechi village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 58 years old, married and has four children. He is engaged in cattle breeding. He has ten years' experience at this business. He needs a loan in the amount of $400 for developing his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami F. is 44 years-old man, married and father of three children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Nizami is engaged in moveable groceries (a mobile grocery store). He purchases fruits and vegetables from Guba and Khachmaz cities of Azerbaijan and sells them in Beylagan streets. 

Nizami applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan in amount of $350 to purchase more kind of goods, increase the number of his customers and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Emin

texts.en: Emin M. is a 30-year-old man, is married and has two children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He has been driving a taxi for a few years. He is supporting his familty with this business only. Emin applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for the KIVA loan in amount of $1200 to purchase necessary spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali G. is 32 years old, is married and has two children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Ali has his own sweet shop and bakery. He started his business two years ago. He has two employees. He decided to apply for a KIVA loan in amount of $725 from the Normicro Beylagan Branch. He plans to purchase new equipment for cooking sweets.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his bakery

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en: Eyvaz A. is a 37 year-old man, is married and has one son. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Eyvaz owns and operates a food market in Beylagan. He established his business six years ago. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan in the amount of $600, and he plans to purchase more kinds of goods and increase his daily income.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Alekber

texts.en: Alekber M. lives in Beylaganm, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 39 years old, married and has three children. He is engaged in fruits and vegetables sales in the Beylagan city bazaar. Alekber started his business more than five years ago. Now he needs a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase more kinds of goods and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Emirhan

texts.en:
Emirhan J. is 32 year-old manwho is married and has two children, He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Emirhan is a cameraman.He has been recording with a video camera wedding pictures, birthday pictures, and holiday ceremonies. He has been engaged in this business for more than ten years. He is pleased with his job, but his camera is very old. Because of this he can not record high-quality. 

Now he needs a loan in amount of $1200 to purchase a new video camera and increase the quality of his business.

loans.use: To purchase new video-camera

loans.name: Chu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Chu Thị L., 54 years old, lives with her three children in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She is a fourth year member of the TYM Fund. She’s been divorced for many years and singly raised her children. Besides rice farming, she does animal husbandry. Pigs and cows. Her grown up children help their mother’s business. This round of loan she is applying for a 450USD to buy piglets and feed. The current family’s monthly income is 150USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Chu Thị L., 54 tuổi, sống cùng 3 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chị đã ly dị chồng từ nhiều năm trước. Một mình chị L. làm lụng nuôi 3 con. Ngoài việc đồng áng, công việc chính của chị là chăn nuôi lợn, bò. Hiện nay các con chị đã lớn và giúp mẹ được nhiều việc trong gia đình nên chị L. không còn quá vất vả như trước. Vòng vốn này chị L. xin vay 450USD dùng vào việc mua lợn con và thức ăn. Thu nhâp hiện tại của gia đình chị là 150USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Nhâm, 47 years old, lives with her husband and 5 children in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She is a fourth year member of the TYM Fund. The family’s business is farming and animal husbandry. She buys calves and raises for few months then resells for profits. Her husband, Mr. Hoa, farms and does as hired construction labor for extra cash to pay the monthly payments. They try hard to provide education for their two children who are still in school. This time she is applying for a 650USD loan to buy young calves. The family income is 200USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhâm, 47 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 5 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Hoạt động chính của gia đình là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi trâu bò. Thông thường chị Nhâm mua nghé, bê về nuôi trong vài tháng, khi được giá chị bán thu lãi. Để có tiền trả tuần ngoài làm ruộng, anh Hoa, chồng chị, còn đi làm thuê (thợ nề, thợ xây) để có thêm thu nhập. Trong gia đình còn có hai con đang đi học nên anh chị cũng khá vất vả. Chị Nhâm đã xác định sẽ cố gắng để các con được học hành tới nơi tới chốn. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 650USD để mua thêm bê về nuôi. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hồ Thị Bình, 47 years old, lives with her husband and 6 children in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She is a third year member of the TYM Fund. Two of her 6 children are still in school. Monthly expenses for their education are 30 to 40USD. To provide education for those two and household expenses Mrs. Bình and her husband run a small animal husbandry business. They buy calves, feed them for few months the resell for profit. The current income of 200USD a month is barely sufficient. She is applying for a loan of 450USD to buy more calves and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hồ Thị Bình, 47 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 6 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị Bình là thành viên năm thứ 3 của Quỹ Tình thương. Trong số 6 người con của chị có 2 người còn đang đi học. Chi phí cho việc học hành của 2 cháu hàng tháng khoảng 30-40USD. Để có tiền cho con ăn học và nuôi sống gia đình, chị Bình cùng chồng mua lợn, bò về nuôi và bán lại khi được giá. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chỉ đủ cho những khoản chi phí hàng ngày và trả tiền tuần. Với mong muốn tăng thêm thu nhập, vòng vốn này chị Bình xin vay 450USD để tiếp tục đầu tư cho công việc chăn nuôi của mình. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy piglets and calves

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs L Thị L. is 40 years old. She is married and has 4 children. They live in Hưng Nguyn, Nghệ An. Her husband is a farmer. Beside working on their rice paddy, Mrs L. also raises pigs, poultry and cows. This is the main income source for her family. On average, they make 150-180 USD a month. Their 4 children are attending school and the expenses are high. Mrs L. and her husband are determined to work hard to provide their children the highest education. This time Mrs L. is requesting a loan of 775 USD to buy piglets, chicks and animal feed. Mrs L. is a 4th year member of TYM fund

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị L., 40 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Thọ, là một nông dân. Ngoài làm ruộng, công việc của chị L. là chăn nuôi lợn, gà, trâu. Đây là nguồn thu nhập chính của cả gia đình. Mỗi tháng gia đình chị thu từ 150-180USD. Cả 4 cháu của chị L. đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học nên chi phí rất tốn kém. Chị L. cùng chồng thống nhất cố gắng lao động để các con được học đến mức cao nhất. Vòng vốn tới chị L. xin vay 775USD để mua lợn, gà con và thức ăn gia súc. Chị L. là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương.

loans.use: Buy piglets, chicks.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Thủy, 32 years old, singled, lives in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Her occupation is in clothing. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She started her career at a vocational school with a tuition fee of 50USD a month. After 6 months she starts a tailor shop at home. Few months after that her shop becomes well known in the area and her income picks up pretty well. It is 200USD a month presently. She is applying for a loan of 825USD to stock up material and to expand her shop. Weekly repayments are easy for her since her income is very steady.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Thủy, 32 tuổi, chưa lập gia đình, hiện đang sinh sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Công việc chính của chị hiện nay là kinh doanh hàng may mặc. Chị làm nghề này được 5 năm. Bắt đầu với việc đi học ở trung tâm dạy nghề, chi phí hàng tháng là 50USD. Sau 6 tháng chị Thủy mở cửa hàng may mặc tại nhà. Sau một vài tháng, cửa hàng bắt đầu có những khách quen thu nhập dần đủ chị trang trải chi phí cho cuộc sống. Đến nay thu nhập của cửa hàng đạt 200USD/tháng. Cửa hàng có khách thường xuyên, việc hoàn trả tuần của chị Thủy càng thêm thuận lợi. Dự kiến vòng vốn này chị xin vay 825USD để mua thêm vải may quần áo tăng thêm lợi nhuận cho cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy material and expand her tailor shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L., 35 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She is a fourth year member of the TYM Fund. Her occupation is tending a general store. She has this store for 3 years now. The operation is convenient for the weekly repayments. She used funds from her last loan to invest in poultry and buy more goods for her store. Her husband is a village cadre and her two children are in school age. The current family’s income is 220USD a month. She would like to take out a loan of 950USD to expand her general store and hope with that loan she will increase the family’s income to 250-270USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị L., 35 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ. Công việc chính của chị L. là bán hàng tạp hóa. Chị mở cửa hàng được 3 năm. Công việc này thuận lợi cho việc trả tiền tuần. Các vòng vốn trước chị vay vốn về chăn nuôi và mua hàng. Chồng chị là cán bộ của xã, hai con chị còn đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 220USD/tháng. Dự kiến sắp tới chị xin vay 950USD để mua hàng bán. Mong muốn của chị L. là thu nhập sẽ được tăng lên 250-270USD trong thời gian tới.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi L., 55 years old, is living with her husband and 4 children in Hung Nguyen, Nghe An. Her husband is a farmer. Her 4 children are all grown-up. Besides working on the rice field, her main activity is to breed pigs and chickens. Her fund came from family savings and borrowed money from TYM Fund. Her money to repay weekly comes from selling stuff in the market and from her children. Her family current income is 300 USD/ month. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy chickens, pigs and food for them. Mrs. L. is the 7th member of the TYM Fund.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Liễu, 55 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chồng chị là một nông dân. 4 người con đều đã trưởng thành. Ngoài làm ruộng, công việc chính của chị Liễu là chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Nguồn vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi được lấy từ bản thân gia đình và vay từ Quỹ Tình thương. Số tiền trả tuần của chị Liễu được lấy từ tiền chạy chợ của chị và các con đi làm hỗ trợ. Thu nhập hiện tại của cả gia đình là 300USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Liễu xin vay 950USD để mua gà, lợn và thức ăn gia súc. Chị Liễu là thành viên năm thứ 7 của Quỹ Tình thương.

loans.use: Buy pigs, chickens and food for them

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phan Thi M., 25 years old, is living with her husband and her 4-year-old children in Hung Nguyen, Nghe An. She is the 4th member of TYM Fund. Her husband, Mr. Nguyen Van Sang, is a farmer. Besides working on the rice field, her main activity is breeding the cows and pigs. Every year she releases 3-4 litter of pigs and earns 500-600 USD. Her fund for breeding came from her family savings and borrowed money from TYM Fund. To repay the money weekly, she sells vegetables and dried food in the market. Mrs. M. thinks the weekly repayment method of TYM Fund is very suitable for her family. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy pigs, pig mash and cattle-feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị Mỹ, 25 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai 4 tuổi tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Sáng, là một nông dân. Ngoài làm ruộng, công việc chính của chị Mỹ là chăn nuôi bò, lợn. Mỗi năm xuất chuồng 3-4 lứa lợn, mỗi lứa chị Mỹ thu 500-600USD. Nguồn vốn đầu tư cho chăn nuôi được lấy từ gia đình và vay của Quỹ Tình thương. Để có tiền trả tuần chị bán rau quả, hàng khô ngoài chợ. Chị Mỹ cảm thấy cơ chế hoàn trả của Quỹ rất thuận lợi với gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD để mua lợn và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs, pig mash and cattle-feed

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vo Thi O., 35 years old, is living with her husband and 2 children in Hung Nguyen, Nghe An. Her husband is a farmer. Her family main activity is to work on the rice field. Because her 2 children are still going to school, she has to spend money on schooling. Mrs. O. breeds pigs and chickens to earn some extra money. Because plowing on the rice field requires a lot of strength, she talks to her husband and decided to borrow 950 USD to buy the plowing-tractor. She also will plow for those who are in need. Doing this will increase her family income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Võ Thị O., 35 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chồng chị là một nông dân. Công việc chính của gia đình là làm ruộng. Hai con còn đang trong tuổi đi học nên chi phí khá tốn kém. Chị O. cũng chăn nuôi lợn, gà để kiếm thêm đồng ra, đồng vào. Việc cày cấy vất vả, chị O. bàn với chồng và xin vay 950USD mua máy cày về giảm bớt gánh nặng trong công việc đồng áng. Ngoài ra chị cũng nhận cày thuê những gia đình có nhu cầu. Việc này sẽ tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: Buy a tractor-pulled plough

loans.name: Livia

texts.en: Livia is a seventy-eight year old widow who lives in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. To make a living, Livia prepares and sells fried vegetables with chicken or pork meat. This activity is her principal source of income. Occasionally she receives money from her five grownup children, whom all have their own families now. With her loan (the second one she will take from FSMA), the entrepreneur will purchase raw materials to keep producing for her customers and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Livia would like to purchase raw materials to produce fried food to sell in her community.

loans.name: Patricia María

texts.en: Patricia is thirty-six years old and an excellent entrepreneur. She sells men’s and women’s clothing in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. She explains with enthusiasm that her business is very promising, since she has a growing clientele. Patricia plans to boost her business and add a wide variety of new clothing to her present inventory. That way, she’ll increase her sales volume and attract new clients. The entrepreneur has five children, four of them boys, all of whom attend school. Her business supports their educations.

loans.use: Patricia would like to buy clothing wholesale in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Germania

texts.en: Germania sells a collection of chic pants to women of the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. Currently, Germania operates the business from her house, but she plans to rent a small locale before long in order to make it easier for her customers to purchase the goods she sells. The entrepreneur left her husband three years ago, and since then she has been working hard to make a living. Germania has no children sadly but says that operating actively in her business helps her forget and ‘dissipate’ her pains. With her loan, Germania will buy new sizes, styles and also customer-recommended pants to add to her stock.

loans.use: Germania would like to buy a new collection of pants to sell so as to diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em K., 53, works as a vendor of grocery products, making an average profit of $2 a day . Her husband, Mr. Sous Ton, 51, raises pigs, earning about $2 a day of profit. They have five children, two of whom work in a factory, typically earning $60 each per month. This couple is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase more pigs for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em K., 53, works as a vendor of grocery products makes on average $2 a day of profit. Her husband Mr. Sous Ton, 51, is a pig raiser, earning about $2 a day of profit. They has five children two of who works in the factory typically earns $60 each a month. This couple is in needs of some money about $250 to breed the pigs. To purchase more pigs they are now requesting a loan from Kiva around $250.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Simorn is widow with two sons who are studying in the local school. Simorn lives with her old father and her sons. Simorn and her family live along National Road number two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has worked full time at a company in Phnom Penh since 1995. 
Simorn is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. She will use this money for repairing her house.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Mrs. S. Savy is a widow with no children. She lives with her sister. Savy has been weaving silk, a skill learned from her mother, since 1980. Her sister is also a silk weaver too, and they both work at home. Neither went to higher grades in school. They are requesting a $500 loan from MAXIMA to improve their business production, which will improve their living conditions. Savy has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times in the past. With her new loan, she purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Amin Allah

texts.en:
Amin Allah N. lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and father of two children. He has a shoe shop, a business he started 5 years ago. He has good numbers of clients, specially women, in Kabul.

Amin Allah wants to import more shoes for his shop, but for that he needs money. He wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good monthly income to help his family and build up a better business in the future. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Azimhuja

texts.en: Since he was sixteen Azimhuja has been providing taxi services with his car. In spite of his young age, Azimhuja is very diligent and hard working. He is dreaming of developing his business in the future and with this purpose he has applied for the loan of $225.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts for his car in order to be able to provide services of higher quality to his clients. Let us help this young man develop the business that will play an important role for the future of his family. Borrowing for the first time, Azimhuja promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Mrs. L. Hou and her husband have been married since 1972. They have ten children, six sons and four daughters. Four of their children are full time workers, and the other six study in a local school. Hou has been in the business of weaving silk and fishing since 1970. Meanwhile, for over twenty years, her husband has worked as a fisherman and wooden-house repairer. Hou and her family live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Both husband and wife hope that their business will be able to support the family and will enable their children afford to study in as high a school level as possible.      
Hou is requesting a loan in the amount of $1100 from MAXIMA to repair her house. This will be her fifth loan.

loans.use: For House Repair

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Saum and her husband have been married since1975. They have seven children, four sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives in Phnom Penh. Of the other six, four are full time workers and one is studying in a local school. Saum and her husband are have been farming since 1980. They grow tomatoes, wax gourd, papaya, and eggplant in the farm near their house. Saum and her family live on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Saum is requesting a first-time loan in the amount $500 from MAXIMA for expenses related to growing tomatoes and wax gourd.

loans.use: For expenses related to growing tomatoes and wax gourd

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Samorn and her husband have five children. Two of their children are married and live in separate houses. Of the other three, one farms, one weaves silk, and the youngest one is studying in a local school. Samorn has been a silk weaver since 1986. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a farmer who grows tomatoes, wax gourds, papaya, and eggplant on the farm near their house. Samorn and her family live on an island of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Samorn is requesting a first-time loan from MAXIMA in the amount $600. She will use this money for purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Hassiba

texts.en:
Hassiba lives in district 14 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has one son. She is an educated woman and a teacher. She has small courses where she teaches English, Dari, and Pashto, and she has good numbers of students in her courses.

Hassiba would like to expand this little business so she wants to take an individual loan to buy chairs, desks, and other necessary materials and supplies for her courses so as to attract more students and make a good income. She is happy that she can further her business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy chairs and desks, etc.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Pol, 47, and her husband have been married for twelve years. They have one adopted son who lives with them. Pol and her husband have been in the business of weaving silk and raising pigs for twenty years. Weaving is a skill they learned from their mothers in 1988. Their son is also a silk weaver. Pol and her family live across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Pol is requesting a loan in amount $1000 from MAXIMA for the fifth time. She will use this money for expenses related to raising pigs and buying silk material for weaving.

loans.use: For expenses relatead to raising pigs and buying silk material for weaving

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en: Mrs. S. Sokhum and her husband have been married since 2002. They have two sons who are still young and stay at home. Sokhum has been in the business of raising pigs and growing rice for three years. Her husband, Oy Tin, is a worker and farmer. Sokhum and her family live across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan in the amount $500 from MAXIMA for the second time. She will use this money to purchase baby pigs for raising and for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs and for growing rice

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Pon has been married for eight years and has three children, two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in local school and her two sons still young stay at home. She sells lotus flowers and grows rice for her income. Her husband cannot work because of serious illness. She brings lotus flowers from her village to sell in Phnom Penh. Pon and her family live national road #5, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.
She is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this money for growing rice.

loans.use: For growing rice

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 33 years old, married, with three children, ages 17, 13 and 6. She and her husband also take care of one other 60-year-old person. Amina owns a grocery store that she opened in 2006. Everyday, she works from 10am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $150 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en:
M. Erkin is 22 years old. Unmarried, Erkin is supporting his parents.

For the last three years Erkin has been involved in baking the national bread called “lepeshka”. Erkin is a rather hard-working young man. He runs his own bakery and dreams of generating the sufficient income to marry.  Erkin plans to have a spacious and convenient shop for baking the “lepeshka”. He would like to purchase more flour and coal for his business. At the same time he needs to repair the current bakery. He requests a $600.00 US dollar loan for the term of 12 months. This is Erink's first loan and he promises to be accurate and prompt in loan repayment and thanks all for their support.

loans.use: To buy flour and coal and repair the bakery.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 27 years old, married, with three children, ages 10, 4 and 1. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 56 and 60. Sharifa owns a small cafe that she opened in 2003. Everyday, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Payanda

texts.en: Payanda lives with his own family in district 14 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and father of four children. He is the only breadwinner in his family. He has a metal shop. He has good experience in this business and he needs to expand his shop, so he has requested an individual loan to expand and make a good monthly income for his family. He wants to support them adequately and enroll his children in a better school. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To expand his metal shop

loans.name: Zainabu's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Zainabu M. is 35 years old, married, with five children, ages 15, 14, 8, 7 and 4. She and her husband also take care of one other person, age 58. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her clothing shop which she started in 2006. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Zuwena's Nyota Group

texts.en:
Zuwena H. is 38 years old, married with three children, ages 18, 7 and 5. Zuwena owns a food vending store that she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who also has a business vending food.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 36 years old and married with 4 children and with 2 children under her care. She owns a restaurant in Kamwokya that she has been running for 1 year. She employs 8 workers, including cooks and waitresses. This is her first loan ever, and she needs it to renovate her new spacious premises that can easily accommodate her increasing customers. Ruth also intends to buy staff uniforms and more chairs and tables. She is really a hardworking and committed lady.

loans.use: Ruth intends to renovate her new premises by buying wall paints as well as chairs and staff uniforms.

loans.name: Muzafara

texts.en:
M. Muzafara is 45 years old. She is married with four children. 

Muzafara has been baking the national bread “lepeshka” for about 10 years. Her two sons help her in the business. Working hard and being a loving mother, Muzafara plans to use the generated income for higher education for her children. Muzafara would like to repair her bakery shop. She requests a $600.00 US dollar loan for the term of 12 months. Let us help this hard-working woman develop her business.  Borrowing for the first time, Muzafara thanks all for their support and trust and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Repair of the bakery shop.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 42 years old, married, with two children, ages 20 and 2. She and her husband also take care of a 55-year-old person. Nuru owns a small cafe that she started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en:
R. Ilhom is 29 years old. He is married with two children of school age. 

Ilhom has been providing taxi service for about 2 years. This business is the main source of income for his family. Ilhom uses gas as a fuel for his car. In order to make the system safer, he wants to install a capron gas tank. He requests $300.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Ilhom, so he thanks all for their trust and support and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase a capron gas tank for his car.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia M. is 32 years old, married, with a 16 year old child. She and her husband also take care of two others aged 58 and 60. In 2005, Sophia started selling clothes and she works everyday from 10am to 4pm at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Sebukoko Buto Community Bank Group

texts.en: Eva K. is such a charming lady. For 20 years, she has been preparing confectioneries at home, with the help of her husband, which she takes for sale to the daily markets locally known as “mubuulo” on different days. However, this is not all that Eva does; at times when she is not making confectioneries, any job that comes her way is a blessing. She does jobs like collecting water from the spring, as well as washing and ironing clothes for a fee. Eva is 30 and married with 4 children, plus 3 children that belong to her co-wife. Her plan is to expand her business to enable her to raise enough profits to buy a plot of land where she can build a house, however small it may be.

loans.use: Eva plans to buy baking flour, cooking oil, and charcoal to enable her to expand her business.

loans.name: Muazama

texts.en:
R. Muazama is 42 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband and elder son help Muazama in the business.

Muazama has been baking the national bread “lepeshka” at her house for the last five years. She is known in her neighborhood as a nice and hard-working woman. Muazama is planning to expand her bakery shop. For now she needs to make majors repair in the bakery and for this purpose she requesets a $600.00 US dollar loan for the term of 12 months. Muazama hopes for support and thanks all for their trust because this is her first loan.

loans.use: Major repair of the bakery shop.

loans.name: Magamaga West B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose D.. She is currently in the business of maize milling and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of maize. Rose is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is a fisherman. She has 2 children. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 48000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to increase the stock of maize. Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to buy more maize and the loan was paid back on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Veronica K., Nabirye L. and Justine N.. Veronica K. has a business in maize milling and wants to add to her business. Nabirye L. is currently operating a business in maize milling and wants a loan to increase inventory. Justine N. operates a business of running a retail shop and wants to add to her stock.

loans.use: To add to maize business and expand it

loans.name: Fatuma's Imani Group

texts.en:
Fatuma R. is 26 years old, married, with two children, ages 7 and 4. Fatuma owns a amall charcoal store that she started in 2007. Everyday she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.en:
S. Lutfullo is 23 years old. He is married with one son, 5 years old.

Lutfullo has been providing taxi services with his car for 1 year. The business is the main source of income for his family. Lutfullo works hard, he gets up early and goes to bed late as to not to lose any clients. The business is successful and generates a stable income, allowing Lutfullo to support his family and his mother and father. 

Today Lutfullo requests $225.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts for his vehicle. Lutfullo is borrowing for the first time and he thanks all for their trust and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Huseyngulu

texts.en: I. Huseygulu is a 49-year-old trader who sells food in a small village in the Saatli region. He has six years of experience in this field. He is married and has three children. Now he applied for 1200 USD to expand his business and increase the number of goods he sells.

loans.use: Going to expand his business and increase the number of goods

loans.name: Magamaga West C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aisha M.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed. Aisha is 38 years old and is married. Her husband has a piggery business. She has 6 children ranging from age 4 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Aisha makes approximately UGX 28000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more poultry feed. Aisha has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy chicken feed and the loan was paid back on time.

Aisha is joined in her small group by Irene B., Irene B., Sylvia M., and Justine K.. Irene B. has a business in tailoring and wants to purchase a sewing machine. Irene B. is currently operating a business in maize milling and wants a loan to increase inventory. Sylvia M. operates a business in maize milling and wants to add to her business. Justine K. is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy more birds.

loans.use: To add to poultry business and boost it

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mrs. Yong H., 26, a mother of four children, is employed as a garment worker at a salary of $90 a month. Her husband, Mr. Hem Mao, 30, owns a plot of land where he grows rice. He earns from his work about $1 a day. Four of their children are currently employed by the garment factory and every month they each earn $80.  To produce greater yield for the family, Mr. Hem Mao is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a tractor for  his rice field.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use the loan to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Azad

texts.en: K. Azad is a 29-year-old farmer who sells milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders. He started his business in 2002 in the small village of Saatli where he has lived for his entire life. He is going to purchase two additional cows and for this purpose he applied for 1200 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase two additional cows

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem S., 38, is married with four children and works as a farmer, making an average of $1 a day. To supplement the household income, her husband, Mr. Dong Ban, 40, works as a palm climber, collecting palm juice and refining it to sugar palm, which he sells to the market, making on average $2 a day. Three of their children are students and one other works as a palm climber, earning on average $2 a day. This couple requests a loan of $300 to purchase a plot of farmland to produce more yield.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use the loan to purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Magamaga West D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fresta M.. She currently has a local brewing business and is requesting a loan to expand the business by adding more capital. Fresta is 38 years old and is married. Her husband sells charcoal for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 9 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Fresta makes approximately UGX 12000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build better business premises. Fresta has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more millet flour and the loan was paid back on time.

Fresta is joined in her small group by Harriet K., Monica B. and Irene N.. Monica B. has a retail business and wants to purchase more shop items. Harriet K. is currently operating a piggery business and wants a loan to purchase more piglets. Irene N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy more food and utensils.

loans.use: To expand local brewing business

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: R. Akif is a 49-year-old farmer who breeds calves for the meat selling in the small village of Saatli. He has been in the business since 1993. He is married and has three children. It is very hard to keep his family in good conditions selling only meat, and Akif has decided to purchase two cows and start selling dairy products as milk and yoghurt. Dairy products are in very high demand all across Azerbaijan, and Akif believes that it will bring him  benefits in the future.

loans.use: To purchase two cows.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: B. Ramiz is a 38-year-old farmer who sells milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders in the small village of Saatli. He started his business in 2004 when he purchased his first cow. As dairy products are in very high demand in Azerbaijan, Ramiz applied for 1200 USD to purchase two additional cows for an estimated cost 600 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase two additional cows

loans.name: Pashali

texts.en: F. Pashali is a 39-year-old farmer who sells milk to the local bazaar traders in a small village in the Saatli region. People in Azerbaijan  use dairy products in their every-day life, and it is a very profitable business. Pashali applied for 1100 USD to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.use: Purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en: Mrs. Chhim K., 28, a widow with no children, sells porridge in front of a nearby school, typically earning around $3 a day.  She currently lives with her younger sister, who works in a garment factory. Mrs. K. wants to borrow $800 to expand her business by purchasing more plates, spoons, etc. in order to sell porridge in larger quantities.

loans.use: She hopes to use this loan to purchase plates, spoons, chairs, a  table, etc.

loans.name: Magamaga West E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Sarah is 35 years old and is married with a husband that sells fish for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 10 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 29000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and invest more capital in the business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more food and materials and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Jane T., Edith N., Hadija Nakaami, and Tappy N.. Jane T. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to expand to bulk selling. Edith N. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to increase stock. Hadija Nakaami operates a business running a bakery and selling spare parts and wants to purchase more baking ingredients. Tappy N. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw food and boost restaurant business

loans.name: Magamaga East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah B.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries. Sarah is 44 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant farmer. She has 5 children ranging from age 20 to 28. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build more business premises. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to buy more fruit and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Annet D., Mary T., Fatuma K., and Perusi T.. Annet D. has a business in poultry keeping and wants to buy chicken mesh. Mary T. is currently operating a business in poultry keeping and wants a loan to buy poultry feed. Fatuma K. operates a business of farming and wants to purchase more farm supplies. Perusi T. is currently in the business of running a drug shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To increase stock in her grocery store

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: B. Islam is a 35-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and three children in the small village of Saatli.  He has been selling milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders for six years. He applied for 1000 USD to expand his business and improve the conditions of keeping cattle.

loans.use: Going to expand his business and improve conditions of keeping cattle.

loans.name: Magamaga East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Irene B.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to increase inventory. Irene is 35 years old and is a widow. Each week, Irene makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more in her business. Irene has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Irene is joined in her small group by Bety L., Erina G., Jalia M., and Mary N.. Bety L. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add to her business. Erina G. is currently operating a business in farming and wants a loan to purchase more seeds, watering cans and manure. Jalia M. operates a business running a restaurant and wants to buy more food and furniture. Mary N. is currently in the business of operating a grocery store and is requesting a loan to increase stock in the store.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business and make more profits

loans.name: Magamaga East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sophia N.. She is currently in the business of maize milling and is requesting a loan to purchase more maize. Sophia is 34 years old and is married. She has 2 children, aged 9 and 18. Each week, Sophia makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and invest in her business. Sophia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to buy maize and the loan was paid back on time.

Sophia is joined in her small group by Prossy M., Julie W., Jane N., and Judith B.. Prossy M. has a business selling clothes and wants to increase her inventory. Julie W. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to boost business. Jane N. operates a business running a restaurant and wants to buy more raw food and utensils. Judith B. is currently in the business of farming and is requesting a loan to improve business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize and expand business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam Z. is a married 38 year old with two children who are 10 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other children. Mariam sells clothes and she works at her business from 7am to 10pm everyday. She can earn a monthly profit of about $210 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Magamaga East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joy B.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling. Joy is 28 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 16 and all her children go to school. Each week, Joy makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more in her business. Joy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Joy is joined in her small group by Jane W., Faridah T., Jane S., and Julia M.. Jane W. has a business in clothing sales and wants to add to the business. Faridah T. is currently operating a business running a grocery store and wants a loan to purchase more groceries. Jane S. operates a business selling coffee and wants to expand the business. Julia M. is currently in the business of selling spare parts and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To boost charcoal business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 34 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are studying in school. His young sister lives with him and is studying in university. He is responsible for her school expenses. He has a car that he operates as a taxi and he has applied to get $1200 to replace his car with a newer one and to do some work on it. He wants to increase his income to provide a better life for his family and help his sister to complete her studies.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Replace his car

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina T. is 48 years old, married, with five children, ages 7 to 30 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other person who is 30 years old. Paulina owns a food vending store that she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Magamgaga Est E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Monica M.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Monica is 32 years old and is married. Her husband has a maize milling business. She has 8 children ranging from age 4 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Monica makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add more capital to the business. Monica has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more maize and the loan was paid back on time.

Monica is joined in her small group by Juliet N. and Margret M.. Juliet N. has a business selling clothes and wants to purchase more clothes for sale. Margret M. is currently operating a business in farming and wants a loan to add to her business and improve the quality of her produce.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items and boost business

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene, a forty-seven year old woman and mother of seven school-going children, lives in the Batey Palavé community of San Cristobal where she runs a small business. Helene sells an assortment of shoes for women and cuddly toys for children in her community. Helene operates her business mainly from her house, but she habitually visits women of the neighborhood to offer her shoes.

Helene says that she wants to change her life and her children’s by the means of her business. She will invest her loan in the purchase of more merchandise to increase her stock and augment her sales volume. That way, the entrepreneur will be in conditions to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Helene would like to buy shoes and cuddly toys for her small business.

loans.name: Hospital East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Babirye Z.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. Babirye is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a cattle trader. She has 3 children ranging from age 8 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Babirye makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business. Babirye has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Babirye is joined in her small group by Ruth Namugere and Milly N.. Ruth Namugere has a business in charcoal selling and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Milly N. is currently operating a business selling potatoes and wants a loan to increase the stock of potatoes.

loans.use: To add to charcoal business

loans.name: Yuly

texts.en: Yuly, a twenty-eight year old woman, is an experienced and successful businesswoman of the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. Yuly started a business selling pants and shoes to people of the community eight years ago, but she’s been immersed in business since her childhood. Yuly says that her activity helps her to provide food for her children and support her education. She also expressed her desire to buy a house where her family can live comfortably. “I’ll work hard to achieve my goal, and I’ll try to not spend my money on alcoholic drinks, as so many people waste their money”, she adds. Yuly will use her loan to buy more merchandise so as to increase her income.

loans.use: Yuly would like to purchase shoes and pants to restock her small business.

loans.name: Anthonia's Tujittume Group

texts.en:
Ester E. is 30 years old, married, with three children, ages 4 to 11. She and her husband also take care of four other children. In 1999, Ester began selling soft drinks, and she works from 8am to 6pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Hospital East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rehema N.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries. Rehema is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 4 children ranging from age 8 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Rehema makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a wholesale shop. Rehema has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more groceries and the loan was paid back on time.

Rehema is joined in her small group by Silisata N., Jesca Katembe and Lydia N.. Silisata N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to increase the stock of shop items. Jesca Katembe is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to add to her business. Lydia N. operates a business running a beauty parlor and wants to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.use: To expand grocery business and make more profits

loans.name: Hospital East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aminah N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. Aminah is 30 years old and is married. Her husband sells wholesale matooke. She has 3 children ranging from age 5 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Aminah makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more linen clothes. Aminah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX in order to buy another sewing machine and the loan was paid back on time.

Aminah is joined in her small group by Monica B., Zamu M. and Madina K.. Monica B. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Zamu M. is currently operating a business in poultry farming and wants a loan to purchase poultry feeds. Madina K. operates a business of charcoal selling and wants to increase inventory.

loans.use: To add to tailoring business

loans.name: Yudelki

texts.en:
Yudelki R. sells new and used clothing to people of the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. Yudelki is in her early twenties, and she and her husband have a newly born girl. The entrepreneur explains that her businesses help her supplement the family’s income and face some of their financial issues. In addition, she says she feels independent since she doesn’t have to wait for a man to give her everything she needs.
Yudelki will use her loan to restock her business. She is putting aside money to rent a small locale before long for the business.

loans.use: Yudelki would like to purchase used and new clothing in bulk for her small business.
